Also try the shrimp balls as appetizer it was so good.  Fresh oysters was so delicious I wish it didn't have limit on how many you can order .  The only down part is the service. It took a really long time to get our orders in otherwise I would had given this place 5 stars.

kD4NCZDWvPLxQmqKl36t5w.text: Definitely a solid 4 stars for Daisho Sushi!!!  We usually don't venture out to this side of town but after seeing so many delicious pictures posted by @aznttboy on my Instagram feed, we had to come check it out!  Came on a Saturday morning so we pretty much had the whole place to ourselves.. Nice clean & open space. They are located in the same plaza as Walmart-neighborhood.   My boyfriend went with the lunch AYCE while I paid a couple bucks extra and went with the dinner price.. I wanted to sample all the special 1per person/dinner only items.. -Oysters / were good! -Yellowtail Poki / came on a bed of seaweed salad and was very good! You can also get tuna or salmon poki.. -Miso Cod / buttery and sweet! watch out for the bones though! -Yakitori Skewers / we got bacon wrapped asparagus, enoki mushrooms, quail eggs & the tuna... These things are huge.. 2 sticks come in 1 order so don't order too much! Bacon anything is delicious although I would have liked the bacon to be a little bit more crisp. -Nigiri / Everything was decently fresh and we didn't run into anything horrible but the standouts for me were the scallops and fatty albacore! mmmmmM -Wild Fire Roll / (no rice) spicy tuna, tuna, albacore & soy paper.. Loved the presentation!  -Miso Soup / seemed a bit watered down & they don't offer the option to add the shrimp head to it. -Dessert / we had the standard green tea ice cream & yuzu sorbet.. hopefully they add some more creative desserts to the menu!  Service was fast from our server although sometimes it seemed there was a language barrier but he was very efficient. The sushi chef who helped us was nice and kept the conversation going and the food a-flowing.. Forgot his name but he likes to play golf and he is from S. Carolina LOL  HOT TIP: Ask for a stamp card!!!!  Watching what you eat? No problem, they have like 6 non rice rolls + several fish only appetizer items.

JxgQN7gbWEioDZTLGURCqg.text: *This visit was just THREE days after Tony T.'s and Michael K.'s 5-star experience....  Before meeting up with the gang for some Bingo action at South Point, we decided to get our sushi on here after hearing that they had good nigiri, kick-ass appetizers, and that the head sushi chef was from Blue Ribbon inside the Cosmopolitan. Already with high expectations and an appetite for destruction, we sit up at the bar, go all-in with AYCE.  We start off with both the salmon and tuna poke. The salmon was good, but the texture of the tuna was kinda suspect...gave them the benefit of the doubt, and ordered up some nigiri- Uni, Blue Crab, Fatty Albacore, and Amaebi. "The Amaebi is not good...too small" says our sushi chef......OH....KAY??? "The tuna is good" he says...so we put our trust in him, and dig in. Uni is good, Blue Crab is sweet, but the tuna lacks its glistening fresh appearance and again, I'm hesitant, trying the Fatty Albacore which looks butchered and is barely cold, almost body temperature...I chase that bad feeling with my Iced Green Tea, then I ask where the tuna is from...his answer?  Hawaii...after tasting the mediocre tuna, I knew for a fact that it did not come from the 808 State and that this knock off sushi chef was playing me for a chump! I much rather have had that smaller Amaebi, but then again, who knows how fresh that was!?  Little did he know that he was messin' with The Goyemonstah......  Little did he know that the Goyemonstah was born and raised in Hawaii AND worked at a fishmarket with some of the best tuna from our own waters...  and VERY little did he know that The Goyemonstah wanted to reach over the display case and.....Never mind!  We ditched the nigiri section and ordered off the appetizer section-Miso Black Cod, Hamachi Kama, and a few Yakitori-Bacon Wrapped Quail Eggs, Bacon Wrapped Asparagus, and Bacon Wrapped Enoki Mushrooms. I expected Yakitori items and the grilled fish items to arrive on separate plates, but what we got was a pupu platter complete with orange slices delivered by the former Blue Ribbon sushi chef himself with everything on the same plate! The flavors from the Miso Black Cod and the  "Ha-Ka"(Half of a Hamachi Kama, not to be confused with the war chant that the New Zealand All Blacks perform before they prepare to kill the opposing team) all blended with the Yakitori which was a big fail in presentation. They probably tested the other half of the Hamachi Kama for freshness? We ordered a some scallop, salmon, and saba nigiri, still just okay, and the cure on the saba was barely evident.  I order a Shark's Tale, Wild Fire, and What's Wrong? Roll. The Shark's Tale mentions tempura snow crab...it is tempura imitation krab. Wild Fire Roll was okay and the What's Wrong roll was swimming in sauce and was alright. I think our Yuzu Sherbet and Green Tea Ice Cream were sadly the highlights here. No half rolls allowed until your last order, and only one dessert per person FYI....  Shady quality of fish, lack of presentation and witnessing lots of shortcuts(they don't make their tamago, and soft shell crab is fried, chopped, and prepared way in advance-YUCK!) does not warrant a return visit here....ALOHA!!!

_ajraP-Mh3ivMRf1-_awOg.text: First off let me say that this business is notorious for sending hate mail when the reviewer/customer does not rate this place highly.  Now let me save you the trouble by saying that I will not read hate mail so don't bother as I am sure you will also not bother in making any necessary changes for ALL patrons to be fully satisfied when dining here.    We came here on a Saturday evening and it was completely dead which was the first red flag.  We had heard good things by a few peeps so we decided to give it a go.    We started with a few skewers and a kama  or I should say half of a kama which were all crowded all on the same plate thrown over a bed of cabbage accompanied by an overpowering smelly orange slice. AWEFUL!   Everything we ordered looked nothing like the pictures we saw on yelp. No wonder they frown on picture taking.  So disappointed that I stopped at the second order and could not go on.  It gets worse ...the "sushi chef" also kept shaking his head NO on certain items suggesting they were not of good quality. I noticed that my husband kept ordering other items as if trying to convince himself that it couldn't get worse...but that's all they serve here and he soon realized they just could not be saved.  They also do not offer half rolls and offer 1 dessert per person and with too many restrictions at an all you can eat joint makes for a very un-fun experience all together.   There is just way too much competition out there and you unfortunately only have in many cases one attempt to cause a good first impression with me. GOOD LUCK!!

PPJ9zQU5t41QzCuWVFolLQ.text: It has been a really LONG time since i've been really wowed by sushi. I came to a point in my life where I really questioned whether or not sushi, in general, has become perpetually trite. After visiting Daisho, my opinion of sushi has changed. This is now my favorite AYCE sushi spot in Vegas, and what they are doing here is surprisingly wonderful. Here's why:  First, after walking in the door and being seated by the server at the bar, we were given our menu's. They had the expected items you would see on any sushi menu, but after looking at the appetizer menu, you can tell that these guys are trying to do things distinctive. We had the AYCE menu for 25 bucks, and Tony T. and I started our voyage through this unique menu.  Note: We tried a great volume of items, so I would probably max out the 5000 character limit on Yelp reviews by describing only 1/4 of what we had. There was zilch that I didn't like on menu, but there some dishes that are especially noteworthy.  : Salmon Collar/Yellowtail Collar - This was unbelievable. I was totally blown away, especially by the salmon. The first time I had collar of a fish was at Yonaka, and it was wonderful. On the other hand, the collar at Daisho completely blows Yonaka's out of the water!!! Wonderfully tender, with the natural fat sustaining the moistness of the fish, personally (especially with the salmon), I thought I was eating foie gras. It was prepared with an expert hand, and cooked with precision.  It absolutely melted in the mouth. I'm still thinking about it.  : Uni and Ikura (salmon roe) nigiri - Freshest and highest quality uni and salmon roe i've ever had, EVER. The uni had a delicate, but firm texture, and had a clean taste. The same goes for Ikura as well.   I FINALLY found a place that makes sushi rice correctly!!!! A great deal of people think that it's effortless to create great sushi rice. What folks don't realize is, that in world-class sushi restaurants, sushi apprentices and beginner trainees spend 3-4  (or more) YEARS learning just how to make rice, before they are given the permission to touch a piece of fish. Making sushi rice in itself, is an art form. And these guys nailed it.  A small footnote: This locale is great for low-carbers. There are more than 5 rice less rolls and plenty of apps that do not contain starch or rice, including collar, poke, oysters, yaki-tori and more!!

zTrRQtN7belkKcZksrKG-w.text: Note to self: five rolls of sushi are too many. I (over)ordered the Alaskan, Eel, Salmon Skin, Spicy Scallop, and Spicy Yellowtail rolls. I didn't care so much for the Spicy Scallop and Spicy Yellowtail, but the rest was good. 0pXamJ0y-4JkpzcqTLNxMA.text: Another AYCE sushi joint in Vegas??    The reason why I am giving them 5 stars :  Yakitori is GREAT.  Asparagus, Enoki, Quail Egg...all great!  Great sauce, great cooking consistency...yummy!  The Apps...some great ones here.  The Ahi Poke was plentiful and fresh, Oysters were smooth and also fresh tasting, Sake Kama was delicious and cooked perfectly (unlike the Hamachi Kama).  Nice to change it up a little besides just the run of the mill sushi.  The ROLLS.  I don't usually eat rolls...I am more of a nigiri guy myself.  But the few rolls I tried actually impressed me!  They aren't completely drenched in heavy sauces, and have lots of flavor!  The ones I enjoyed most :  Starfish : Yellowtail Tempura, Tuna, Daikon, Ponzu, and Wasabi Oil. Delicious!! Best "roll" I had here, especially since there is no rice!  I'd order this every time I am here!  Wild Fire : Spicy Tuna, Chopped Albacore, and Garlic Sauce. This was pretty good...lots of fish in each bite.  What's Wrong Roll : Shrimp Tempura, Soft Shell Crab, Masago, Rainbow Fish, and Screaming Orgasm Sauce. I liked this roll as well...the soft shell crab adds a nice taste and consistency.  Overall, the nigiri was also fresh and tasty.  I enjoyed the Uni here, Salmon Belly, Garlic Ahi, and Hotate.  Good cuts!  Finish off with some Plum Ice Cream! I enjoyed this much more than the Yuzu...good stuff!  They also made us some bacon ice cream...good!  Very clean restaurant, and the servers and staff were very fast, efficient and friendly.    Pics :

EPpnQTbGA01GRfo0c2ZSuA.text: Had ayce lunch ($19.95ea) for two here on a Sunday noon and was pleasantly surprised.  The restaurant didn't have very many patrons at the time we came in, maybe five or six other tables aside from us so service was super fast.  Our food was being delivered almost faster than we can eat them, old plates being taken away just as quick, and our beverages never less than half full.  The facility was also sparkly clean as what you can expect from a brand new spot.  We were able to sample the majority of their nigiri and found them to be very good overall.  The fish were as fresh and had a good rice to fish ratio.  They do seem to make the nigiri a bit smaller than average, which I appreciate since this gives you the opportunity to sample other items on the menu and not get full too quickly.  I also feel that you can get a better taste of the food if you're mouth is less stuffed per bite.  We also sampled a good number of their yakitori and totally loved each one.  This is probably what sets them apart from other ayce joints.  Sure you can find yakitori elsewhere but their bacon-wrapped yakitori items here is exceptional, one of the most flavorful I've had in recent memory.  We also had both the salmon and yellowtail poke and thought that they were good too, though nothing compared to poke from poke express.  While there are plenty of ayce sushi places in the valley, there are only a handful that are really worth going back again and again.  I'll have to go back here again to be sure and to evaluate their consistency but Daisho sushi looks like a keeper to me.  I would rank this place in the same class and category as Yama and Goyemon in overall food flavor and dining satisfaction.  The best part of it is that Daisho is slightly cheaper in that lunch is only $19.95 and dinner $24.95, where the competition charges 1-2 bucks more.

9UDcb2PaQYvditzdAW0vFg.text: Prompted by glowing recommendations from trusted friends, I finally made a return visit almost two years following my initial ROTD-earning write-up of Daisho Sushi. What I got was an enjoyable AYCE sushi meal that hadn't diminished in quality much if at all.  I'd been due to eat sushi with one of my pals for a while, and I convinced him to try this place instead of the usual "Mon" restaurants. We were planning a lunchtime meal, and Daisho still allows you to pay for the $25.95 AYCE dinner at any time of the day if you want to get access to special menu items (many of which are one-per-person).  I forgot to ask about whether they still offer fresh wasabi, which is a highlight at my favorite place. Oops.  An additional page has been added to the AYCE menu recently, and this one has various extra tapas/appetizers, some sashimi (one-per-person, dinner only), and some special rolls. My friends had cautioned me to steer clear of the pork belly and the sizzling beef, so I can't report on those. The takoyaki was surprisingly good, with a crispy exterior, tender interior, plentiful bonito flakes, and tasty sauce. The biggest drawback is that the actual tako (octopus) is a pretty small piece.  I also enjoyed the soft shell crab tempura (definitely use the sauce), the yuzu chili salmon "salad" (basically a sashimi), and the sashimi portions of super white tuna and yellowtail w/ jalapeno, but the portion sizes (e.g. nigiri cuts instead of True sashimi) were quite modest considering that these were all one-per-person. The relatively worst item was the ika butter (squid cooked in a sauce), which was a little chewy and forgettable flavor-wise. Lastly, the Iron Man roll (super white inside, tuna on top) was good and still quite palatable at the end of a huge meal.  The appetizers on the classic menu were just as good as before. Bacon enoki was my lone yakitori order. The bacon was meaty and smoky, though still lacking crunchiness, and the enoki was soft yet still has that snap. Miso black cod was still great, although I've tasted a better version of it and therefore don't think the world of this one. The yellowtail collar had meaty portions and fattier, more tender bits. Plus, after one past negative kama experience, "not burnt" is a positive. The fresh oysters were on the small side, but they were really good. The fried oysters were similarly small, which is unfortunate because it's linked to the fresh oysters as one-per-person. Lastly, the baked green mussels were cooked properly and not overly sauced.  Nigiri is still the sushi mainstay, and Daisho delivered for the most part. I loved the flavorful blue crab. The uni was as good as you expect to get in the AYCE quality range, and the amaebi was nice in spite of being a little mushy. Scallop (the good stuff, not bay scallop), yellowtail, and salmon were tasty. The fatty albacore wasn't flavorful, and the default wasabi sauce didn't help. The biggest letdown of the meal was the super white. I realized after ordering the super white tuna salad (a new, one-per-person menu item) and the super white nigiri that (1) they sauce all of their super white with this slightly spicy condiment, and (2) the quality of the super white itself is significantly worse than what other local places offer.  Dessert is one item per person. I won't dock them for what is unfortunately a common policy among these restaurants, but it's always enjoyable to have more dessert. I chose the fried banana this time, and I'm wondering now why I didn't order it in the first place. It's like the banana split in that it's topped with so-called vanilla ice cream, chocolate syrup, and sprinkles, but the banana pieces are fried and give a richness and a warm temperature contrast. Just like last time, I happened to have some leftover bacon to throw on top of this. Just like last time, I enjoyed it. Best AYCE sushi menu hack ever.  It was not very crowded at 1:30-ish, and they provided the expected quick service. The first round of items came out in quick succession from the chefs/kitchen after they'd handled the few other tables' orders, and other rounds seemed to arrive faster. Empty plates were quickly removed too. The only issue was that the server didn't seem to understand that we were ordering for each other or for "the table," so to speak. For example, when we tried to order sashimi for the first and only time, she stopped us and told us that it was one per person. We had to start over and have me call for super white, and him call for the yellowtail. No biggie, but something to be aware of.  Along with the other minor food blemishes, the super white deficiency is why I've decided that I can only give four stars to what's otherwise a solid AYCE sushi restaurant. If you've been to a favorite AYCE sushi place too often and need to change it up, or if you want dinner variety at lunch hours, Daisho remains as good as any secondary options.

y4po2FMCBp8f6nuEnQKyLA.text: I ended up coming here when I was driving around looking for somewhere to go for lunch. VfyTUO_r9bNbvX04YCFJYA.text: This. Is. My. Sushi. Spot. I love it so much, it's al you can eat, and it comes out super fresh. Their rolls are unique and so delicious, and you can always order a half portion so you don't waste any food.  The servers are very sweet and always on top of everything.  I have two boys and they make sure that they have food for them right away, which is so appreciated when you have kids.  The price is fair and they never pressure you eat fast.  I always leave here full and happy.

Not very nice about it and though could have been handled better. Some of the dishes were good but not very impressed with the rolls. o6BLYL4vylNOdx8SIkxoFg.text: Decent food bad service. Waitress seemed to be in a bad mood. I won't be too negative but there was definitely a bad vibe and a very unwelcoming atmosphere about this restaurant. The dessert menu was limited but that's to be expected of a sushi restaurant.

NrxGl1Hp7Zb431PSjV3gWw.text: HORRIBLE. They will cut you off early of your "All You Can Eat" (you will notice obviously when they do) they have to be doing it on purpose to save money its hilarious but i never cared because i would get my full order in ASAP as i realized the "cut off" pattern. I've spent good money at this place because i enjoyed their food but that was also questionable when your puking the next day after a visit and the service is a 50/50 success rate. Tonight was my last visit officially as they had terrible service once again and i had a party of 8 ppl, not only bad service but THEY DID NOT even honor a friend and my own all you can eat dinner cards on SEPARATE checks. The stamp card reads you have to eat 10x All u can eat for 1 Free, Dinner being $27-$28 basically meaning we spent $560 roughly to earn the 2 ($56) free. They only honored one actually AND STOLE OUR SECOND CARD (who creates a whole new punch card and tries to lie about it??) with 6 stamps on it already and gave me one back with 3 when they should have filled the 6/10 stamp card with 4 more stamps as we had 7 "ALL YOU CAN EAT CUSTOMERS" tonight and added 3 extra stamps to a new/next card. I did not know it was this hard to do math for these people but thats obvious too since it took 1 hour NO EXAGGERATIONS to figure out our separate checks with our cards. I love great service and tip VERY WELL brought a big party of friends from out of town and didn't expect such a terrible experience, just to argue over a petty all you can eat for free card. These ppl are cheapskates and i would suggest all future customers to not to waste your time with this place, but u never know might catch them on a non-cheapskate day.

uT_O9nFvWahonuSAxM530w.text: Would give 0 stars if an option.  Really tried to like this place as its close to my home and prices seem reasonable.   Unfortunately the service is by far the worst I've ever experienced.   The waiters/waitress definitely make it very clear that placing an order is a huge inconvenience to them (I'm sorry but isn't that their job?).  It felt like pulling teeth to get anyones attention.  I was able to try 2 rolls which were good, wanted to try another but after waiting a long time to get anyones attention I decided I was done spending any more money at this place.  I was with a friend who decided to order more food and kept thanking the waiter but everytime she did he kept rolling his eyes and throwing her orders down on the table...never once smiled or acknowledged her thanks.  If this business wants to succeed in their current location I suggest getting new staff.  I for one will not return to this establishment and will be surprised if they are still in operation in a few months, no one should pay for terrible service.

photos.caption: Photo of Daisho Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Staff busy doing nothing...

LfAl6gt0QBkiaNNonwOE4A.text: Food was really good. Customer service was great. Very clean. I will definitely go back.   I got ayce and it $26. The also dont rush you and dont halt your orders.

jECtknxs1_gfwbtx_poanQ.text: Cheap, what more can you ask for? Tastes just fine fresh and I get like 6-7 rolls and seaweed salad for 12-15 bucks! Boom! Try it

CYurIxbzQZj8HoFFhIbNkg.text: Japanese cuisine is one of my faves! This place is okay, I like the endless choices available for those who want the All You Can Eat option, and the friendly staff.  However, the many many many dishes we tried were a bit flat...only a few tickled our taste buds. Our favorites here: Kimichi Tuna, Shrimp Bomb, Fried Oysters, Poke, Sex on the Beach, Shrimp Tempura, and the Udon. Yes...we opted for the All You Can Eat Dinner for lunch, came in on empty stomach, and tried to try everything on the menu (we did not even accomplish half!

o73MxIFbhVshXV8MeBBQ6w.text: Our favorite sushi place closed so been looking for a replacement. Daisho did not disappoint. Very friendly staff. Service was very prompt. Did AYCE, very extensive menu. Fish was very fresh. Favorites were spicy girl, salmon love, what's wrong rolls. Sashimi also on AYCE menu and the white tuna and salmon were awesome. They do half rolls, which let us try many different rolls. Long list of appetizers available including black cod and pork belly. Everything was great!! Wish I could have eaten more

nA2JDCzTJlJQliOxKX2YFQ.text: I pass by this area all the time and I've never seen this place! I found it on yelp so we decided to drive from the east side to try this place. It was date night, hubby and I wanted to try a new spot. This place is clean and the employees were extremely friendly with quick service! The hot house saki 2 for 1 during happy hour was awesome!! We were not disappointed with any of the rolls we ordered. Spicy girl was our favorite!! Loved the music they had playing, had me dancing in my chair as I ate. Lol. For a Saturday it was empty so I'm definitely going to be recommending  this place to my friends!

QNassyRTHXVHbKtBDNB0Ow.text: Wasn't sure about this place from parking lot...BUT was starving.  I was pleasantly surprised!! All very fresh and the ALL YOU CAN EAT option is total $$$saver.  This deal included their specials so that was a significant bonus.    Service was prompt.  Dishes artfully prepared and equally delicious.    BEST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!!!  Very close to car rental return at Las Vegas airport...so, don't waste your money on the bad airport food.    You'll be pleased with this place.

GOp4etFOKu8Mq2n_2ZLmaA.text: I've been to Daisho about four times and have had no complaints to date. My last visit, I decided to do AYCE. I usually get my AYCE from Oyshi, and I'm even reconsidering switching to this place as my main joint. Daisho is slightly better and has a better price on it. I was surprised by the roll quality. It wasn't loaded with rice like most places, and the fish was flavorful and not bland. The service was exceptional. My waitress brought out a wrong dish once (the names were similar,) but she immediately brought my correct order out. The yakitori was phenomenal; I ordered it twice. Their nigiri, regular and special rolls, and appetizers were all to my liking, and I will definitely continue to come back!

glKpAYc6zYlggK-RUkdVKg.text: Friendly service and good sushi! One of my regular spots.

0WJge7kviBHc-knocg8qZQ.text: After the last 2 to go orders the quality was very low. I'm not sure if I had a string of bad luck but this recent order alone; the salmon nigiri was fishy, the California rolls were oddly very sweet, the spicy yellowfin was the blandest sushi I've ever tasted, it wasn't spicy either. Because their prices are low they get an extra star. I'm sad because I really liked them at first.  :-(

z28UVokTNUU1OsncP2AGKg.text: Just had the all you can eat lunch here which was $20. The fish and rice tasted fresh. Service was friendly, and efficient, not over bearing which was a nice change of pace for sushi. You know sometimes I just don't want to chit chat, I just want my kamikaze roll and Asahi. I also really like the sauces they use and the rice balls are not too big with the sashimi. All in all an excellent experience.

saEHNcp14VS_QP74XV-TJg.text: From a flavor perspective, you cannot really find a better ayce spot.  Must haves are hamachi kama, black cod, lychee sorbet, garlic tuna and amaebi...

kirQLntieW476f4jXwSS8Q.text: I've been to Daisho sushi twice, once when it first opened, and earlier this evening. It was ok. Their nigiri was good & fresh, and their green tea ice cream was yummy. The service was ok, and the rolls we ordered didn't have much flavor. Perhaps we ordered the wrong rolls... Since I live across the street I thought I would give it a try, but I'll keep going to my regular sushi spot for the same AYCE price.

WeYyyKo19ucxx75XRqC7Ng.text: I just decided to try Daisho Sushi after driving by it to go to another sushi place for months. I go for the AYCE for lunch. pZigiE9V0JTirNnI41JK6w.text: Saw it near my office when it first open, been hooked ever since. The atmosphere is great and the staff is fun and friendly. Number one go to when I'm in the mood for some great sushi!

However, I had an experience here that prevents me from giving five stars. I  have on several occasions ordered the royal kamakazi roll and they would bring me back the kamakazi. The difference is deep fried, hence the word royal. When this happened the third time, the manager told me that the waiter who was making this mistake was new. He did not offer to exchange the roll. Considering that we eat there so much and have never had a complaint, I was disheartened that he responded with an excuse rather than fixing it.

JkFwJkPTJdv1_fhjnxR8bw.text: Daisho staff were very pleasant and courteous. Kindly answered questions and kept our table very clean.   Went during lunch time and although there were several other parties, it wasn't too crowded on this Friday afternoon.   We went with the all you can eat menu which was $21.95 plus tax per person. Very reasonable considering how much sushi usually costs.  There are some items on the menu which can only be ordered during the dinner hours which costs a little bit more ($25.95), but there were only a few of those items...  The service was quick and you can order as much as you want for a 60 minute duration. But don't over order as you will be charged extra for anything that is left that you aren't able to finish.  You are also able to order other items while you are eating so we just ordered as we are which worked out well.  Not only all that, but the sushi was very good.  Tasty and well cooked.  They also have dessert on the menu which you are able to order once you are done with the sushi.  Would definitely eat here again!!

sHN4lh6qTrbhJ8ReJdqL8Q.text: First off... Rude jokes, secondly... The appetizers we ordered were ice cold, third... I ordered a cup of hot water with lemon and the server brings a plastic cup of hot water (straw included), fourth strike was that no refills were offered. Finally they refused to split our check in four ways cause it's "not allowed"!! The manager gave serious attitude after we explained how we were going to pay when he said we could only use two cards. Apparently cards means check. I will not be going there again.

oeeD3LKTBqpoPhj4CSpLLQ.text: Omg, I loved it. Food is great, service excellent, friendly staff, even during their rush hours. We made it into a biweekly girls date. Highly recommended it.

Later in his message he told me that I was not welcome back.  Don't worry, I wasn't planning to go back and give him any of my money.  It only goes to nice/deserving people and sadly he isn't one. 5x4kntbIqwGSldTlK9MNvQ.text: Love this place!!! Every time I'm in Vegas I always have stop for some sushi!!! Some of the best sushi I've ever had. Definitely recommend the X-File!! Absolutely delicious!! The all you can eat deal is amazing!! Definitely worth it!!!

QU3tF8Jv7E_CP1rO-2iZCQ.text: Was in the area and found some good reviews so I decided to pop in for a light dinner.   The bonus is that they have happy hour specials (half price sushi) and an all you can eat option.    I ordered three rolls (rainbow, 007 and Dragon) to curb my appetite.  Overall I was expecting something much better than what I got.   It may have been the fact that the California part of the rolls was a salad mixture not the pieces as per the norm.     The flavor was ok but it just didn't hit the mark for me.   I out that error on me because I probably took it for granted.   I did like the happy hour option so that was a bonus.   Next time I am in town I might find another option.

-5x3JelpGgWzyEFTRrO9gQ.text: Tonight was the 2nd time me and my family ate here and both times we received horrible service. The food is great which is why we decided to come back a second time but after tonight we will definitely not be back to sit down and eat in the restaurant. Our waitress (young asian female with long hair) was extremely rude and had a bad attitude when taking our orders, she did not come back to the table to check up on us or to refill any of our drinks, we waited around for our check for about 30 minutes; they even cleared our table without giving us our check. At this point I was so upset that I walked up to the register and waited there for our check. If I was rating this restaurant according to customer service, I would give them a big 0. I suggest the management team step up and properly train their waitresses on providing good customer service, or else they will continue to lose  business.

OLmus_FZPIEgodSoiXo0mw.text: It is unfortunate that I have to give this place one star, since I did have high hopes. The food is mediocre to be way over priced . When ordering food she had attitude and rolled her eyes. When asking questions about the food on the menu . She didn't come often to check on our table or to refill our water . The night was super slow and there were only two customers present That I counted . This place is not worth going to and I wished I would of listen/read the other reviews posted about the over priced food and lacking service. Nether less I will not be returning but I do recommend everyone to try Blue Fin sushi on sunset . Service is always on point , food is authentic and delicious, and super/more affordable.

ZwX-KGsbqf_d3q-cO_81Xg.text: This is our second time here and it was just as good as the first. Prices for all you can eat are great ($24.99 I think) and you get a lot of choices. Order half or whole rolls. They do it all. Their miso soup is awesome. Their garlic tuna is to excellent and has great flavor. Choices for desert are so so... fried bannana, bananna split, or the typical ice or mochi but I've been to other sushi places that only offer the typical Japanese deserts so this didn't bother me at all.   Customer service both behind the bar and outside is fantastic. We never had to ask for refills as they were dine automatically and our empty plates never sat for more than 2 minutes. The sushi chefs are very friendly. They take time to talk to you and have a conversation while they make food.   We will definitely keep coming here when we are in the area.

a_unB80NsgndYPaoXhRWFg.text: Not sure what to say that others haven't said. My husband and I tried this place after reading reviews. 9Z7mUhvUV3pfR1zve_AbLg.text: Customer service is top notch . The service is quick and its right next to my job so when I prefer out door seating they have a large covered patio with decorative lights . My personal favorite is the Las Vegas Roll, and all you can eat is an optional.

NCgZ5icwdI1rLiSvHoDnCA.text: This was our first time visiting Las Vegas and we wanted to put some sushi down without emptying our pockets before the casinos. We opted for the all-you-can-eat menu, and it is basically everything on their menu! Plus, it was only $27 per person. There is a 90-minute time limit, and they charge you extra if you leave any leftovers, but you wont need the time limit because whatever you order will be pushed to your table in less than 5 minutes!

eFFS0VoXlQyR1v8UUscHlQ.text: THIS PLACE STILL SUCKS.   By far the worst sushi experience I have ever had. It took over 20 minutes to get the first round.

PryIznJj0y3jKp1GWTCxOg.text: I discovered this place is the closest ayce sushi restaurant to my work. They also open at 11 which is convenient when most other sushi places in the area don't open until 11:30. There is a wonderful sushi chef here that used to work at Oyshi on Sahara. He is amazing in his own right and can pump out some amazing signature creations catered to your taste. I ventured here with a coworker and chowed down on some rolls and nigiri. She ordered a few of the fried appetizers and enjoyed them all. The nigiri was fresh and the specials were surprising for a lunch menu price. The sharks tale roll was tasty. The salmon and hamachi nigiri were so fresh we ordered multiples. We will definitely be back for more lunch excursions as the prompt service and quick ordering makes for plenty of time to waddle back into the office within a decent amount of time.

f3urz14c723q_BRBgbEBXA.text: Amazing and friendly !!our service is always top notch. We used to dine at Sushi-Mon every time , that was until the first time we came here and haven't looked back since!! This is the spot to try!! Don't let the last 3 terrible businesses located here change your mind!! This place is remodeled and completely cleaned up!! Fresh fresh fresh , what else do you want at a sushi bar!!

yM1Q7I465UOij8rqU97L_w.text: It's only been open over a week and I've been here over 5x already really good and the staff is friendly... Sushi is fresh and doesn't take to long to get In front of you also everything taste great highly recommend coming here.

mGzrPUKOxj2gfVAw2bii1A.text: Sushi was bomb! My first time in today, will definitely be back.  It's very clean and staff is awesome and friendly

HV7ZPsWICkYFed8_7gb09g.text: Very disappointed and will never come back. This place was one of my favorite places to go until today. I like to go because children eat free with their parents. Today they told me that I'd have to pay half price ($13) for my daughter if she were to share with me, whom is only 30lbs. This was very misleading as the previous times I never had to pay for her and no where on the menus or displays does it say they charge depending on age. The all you can eat menu even says that children can share with all you can eat parents. She's 5 years old but because she's so small she eats just as much as a 2 year old. I ended up ordering her a full plate of yakisoba (this was the cheaper choice) for $7 which she barely put a dent in. We took nearly the whole thing home. When I spoke to the manager, he said that it was a normal thing and they have always charged. He said they always charge based on age because children eat at varying levels. I told him to look at her and look at how much she ate (or didn't) and he continued to argue with me. After arguing back and forth I thanked him for his time and told him I will never be back but he didn't care. He really needs to clarify this, fix the menu, and most of all fix his customer service skills! I should be reporting this to Channel 8, Consumer Reports, and/or BBB!

UKPDddetPTphR73rToL_rw.text: This place was OK,not great. I'm not a big sushi person but I've had tastier dinners at other sushi places. Too much rice,not enough of the good stuff. Frozen Shumai dumplings. Won't return.

myzwFy_Rf_7GuVN2PvvGeQ.text: I heard about this place through Groupon, & I'm so glad I did.  We ate here on a Fri from 6-7 pm & we were seated right away. Our server was very fast, attentive & friendly.  The food also came out super fast.  We ordered the daisho fried rice, beef yakisoba, shark's tale roll, gyoza (theirs is deep fried, not pan fried), & shrimp tempura.  Everything was deeeeeeeelicious & good presentation too!  The tempura sauce really stood out because it wasn't like the normal tempura sauce, it was a lot better - really flavorful. The food portions were a good amount for the price. They also have AYCE sushi. Happy hour is from 3-6 pm and 9-11 pm. Half off chef's special rolls. The lighting was nice & bright. I don't like dim restaurants where I can barely see the menu. I live far from this place, but it is worth the drive, so I will be back!

x9LZ33nt3PKRAthvlCPmog.text: food is bomb here! nigiri specially!! been looking for a decent place to go get sushi in henderson....finally found it!!! fish is fresh!! im super picky when it comes to sushi but this place did it. sit by the bar and the chefs will help you out!

1ij7KxhhzgcUM9ElSIFWyQ.text: I went here yesterday for an AYCE lunch for the first time.  The server did not smile from the time I entered, throughout the meal and even when I walked out.  Whenever she gave me a plate or took one away I would always thank her but after getting no response and a blank face, I stopped thanking her. I ordered nigiri ( 2 orders of tako, spicy crab, spicy tuna, garlic tuna, and tai). The first order of tako nigiri came with a small thin slice of lemon and the second order did not come with lemon. So a little inconsistent there but other than that everything was good. Items that are only available for dinner should be clearly noted on the menu. The server said everything with an asterisk under the specialty roll is only available for dinner.  There are way more items throughout the menu that have an asterisk before it so I was kind of confused and had to double check that the poke is included with the AYCE lunch. For appetizers I had the yellowtail poke, enoki bacon yakitori and shrimp bomb. The poke was good but I prefer mine without seaweed. I did not like the shrimp bomb. The shrimp yakisoba was ok. If I see different servers before I go in, I may eat here again.

GVU4Nw5EXnqR600CpAxkZg.text: Absolutely delicious!  One of, if not my favorite sushi place in town. Always great service both at the bar and table. Must try the casino royal roll.

2RV_2SFUwpmyhLgeRlTiEQ.text: AYCE Lunch is not worth it. I know alot of AYCE sushi places have "rules" but their rules makes me not want to come back. One of them being that we can't order half rolls until (as the waitress said) "the end when you're too full for full rolls"... umm... what??

qthRTbAziJPPQE_rBBTIFA.text: I came in for take out so I can't really comment on the service or any other menu items.  I can however comment on the sushi.  The prices are great, at the time of this review they were running a 50% off all sushi.  "You get what you pay for" is certainly how I felt after my first visit, which in this case what not a whole lot.  The sushi rice was not properly cooked, mushy on the outside, crunchy on the inside.  The rolls are thin, not rolled tight and lacked any of the usual cucumber/avocado or toppings/sauces.  The tempura was definitely NOT made to order, hence not crunchy but rather stale, the California roll had nothing but imitation crab, again no cucumber etc.   I was rather excited to see this place as it is conveniently located on my way home from work. Sadly, I will not return.

RZmMURXSIBUi6tLpZYtapw.text: OK, so I am reviewing my bank statement making sure everything is ok and I find a suspicious charge that I am unsure of.  Thinking it may be this restaurant I call to ask the manager what the charge would come up as under a banking statement, as often the name of the restaurant is not the name of the company doing business as the restaurant in question.  So the woman who picks up the phone does not only not want to hand the phone over to the manager/owner, but asks who is calling, I say "one of your customers, I am just trying to figure out if the charge I have on my bank statement is correct"  and she says all of a sudden he is not present at all.  I said I would call back and she asks well "why are you calling?  Do you want to order?" I say no I am calling to figure out if a charge is correct, her response; "Well who is charging you? What statements are being made?" I politely tell her she doesn't understand the proper meanings of these words, so I will call back later when the manager/owner is back.  She says: "He wont be back for a few days.... Would you like to order?"  Wow.  I will never come back here again for not only being treated this way when I am trying to be polite and just talk to the manager, but also for the fact that she won't let me talk to the manager, and third for accidentally finding out that this is the type of place where if you need the owner's/manager's help correcting or verifying a transaction that this is the sort of response you would get.  On a side note: the food was ok, I have had better, but since it is literally across the street I would be here every few days.... not anymore.

C6yvG1qGU0APFmyptTkJHA.text: Average sushi. The yellowtail and salmon collar was the 2 highlights of the dinner. Not worth the trip back.

b9zn7ZjAwGJb1VEGwegScw.text: Food was good, but service was bad! No attention at all. I won't be back to eat at restrant, but will be back to take their food out.

C5hDbgScs3F2UPgnPHYYag.text: This place was a favorite at one time for me. One weekend I went will a group of 4. Everything was good. I'd have to admit the 4 of us maxed out on the all you can eat.  Then I went back a week later this time there was 3 of us. This time there was one huge difference. The staff remembered us from the previous weekend. So our sushi was packed with double the rice. This made it a horrible experience all you could taste was the rice. We said something to the server that there was more rice than last time. She dismissed the claim but did admit to remembering my group. After she walked away she went to the other servers and spoke to them in japenese. Next we could tell they were talking about us. Also I notice the chef was staring at us. I'm 100 percent sure they doubled the rice portion so we wouldn't be able finish so they could charge us extra. That is a shady way to run all you can eat. I will never return.

0isbZh5cXBLhyb3O4beWuw.text: I love this place...i literally order take out from there practically every other day because of their great grand opening prices (50% off regular rolls!!) I hope they continue that special for a long while because they will definitely continue to see me...I've dined in a couple of times and choose to sit at the sushi bar because I've received great service each time & the chefs always make good conversation, the owner is always there and is so friendly, he always makes his rounds around the place and tries to greet all the customers, he personally introduced me to their new happy hour deals which is also great (half off all specialty rolls), their spicy ahi roll recipe changed since they first opened and is a little more spicy and i personally prefer their old one better, but I've had quality food on each visit and will continue to frequent the place

VhIapp64f6Ocn-EU7az9AQ.text: Great Time, Great Food, Great Service. I'm not one to write reviews but I had to for these guys. Had the all you can eat and was not dissapointed. Everything was spot on and the Chef behind the bar asked my girl and I if we like x, x, and x to which he then created something from those items. Get the Bacon Wrapped Mushrooms or Quail Eggs for sure. My Iced Tea was never below Half. And even though we were getting close to closing time they never mentioned or made us feel rushed to leave. Very good experience.

3lfjyUgK9RC161Mg4XtSCA.text: This is our new favorite hang out. We've been there 4 times in 3 weeks. We had our niece's bday dinner here and it was perfect! Everyone is so friendly and it's a casual, comfortable atmosphere. The sushi is delicious! The baked mussels are the best I've had. The baked salmon roll was one of our favorites along with the Shark Tail roll. They serve beer and wine which is great too. Please try this out, it's worth it!

RtyfIp8_9zMiOAphBRES0w.text: the food is amazing..I don't know what should I write..maybe 2 words is enough. amazing,unbelievable.this is the best Japanese restaurant.u try it u love it!

pQpUqSW3gNSJGB4rMipXxw.text: The food was pretty bland and nothing really stood out. The service was REALLY slow, despite there only being 4 seated tables and the servers were not  friendly at all. It wasn't terrible, but there are waaaaaaay better places to go here in Vegas.

kYKxsbc3eLDb8xRzHJA2LA.text: Checked in after we ordered $50 of take out and didnt get my advertised free drink...

xIKBkE00xZgPXa3ryPr4IA.text: Yelpers take heed. Maybe this place was good at one point but there are better places for you to get your sushi on.  Getting our car serviced near by and yelped Daisho as the closest and highest reviews in the general area and took a shot. Went for the lunch $21.95 all you can eat and wow, talk about taking you for a ride. Guys I know it's all you can eat but really way too much rice to fill you up..the proportions are just greedy. Not only that but the fish wasn't fresh, especially the mackerel (which for those who eat it, it's naturally fishy already) was brown and old looking/tasting. If it's not fresh, why serve it. Sorry to go back to the rice, it also was undercooked, had some crunchy pieces that were dry. Hate that.   Service was lackluster. They don't even say hello and goodbye when you leave as in traditional Japanese restaurants. It's funny my wife said even how they walked look like they were dragging their feet.   We complained, paid $70 for two adults and a child, and left hungry because we didn't want to order just to order.   It's sad because the place looks like it would be a good neighborhood sushi joint, but look elsewhere...NO DAISHO FOR ME.

Q0vIY1hJOIKxWkdxvH8o0g.text: I'm not gonna lie I loved this place a lot I loved the avitar roll which I have never had steak on a sushi roll which was dope!! I would definitely recommend this place to a friend. The atmosphere was nice and very comfortable. Please go and give it a try!!

yzjVE5Xgpyzc3g5b9Z5B1w.text: HAPPY HOUR NEVER DISAPPOINTS! Our go-to spot for a quick sushi fix. Our fave rolls are the Fantasy, Royal Kamikaze, Valley of Fire, and Casino Royale. Yummmmm!

b4pa4RhLzMmlVwJWfesJXw.text: This is one my favorite places to go for sushi! You can tell they have quality fish here with lots of flavor. They have a big selection for all you can eat also very friendly staff.

98KbzQYD8EHwptMASpqz4w.text: Excellent experience last night. Over food quality was fantastic. Service was efficient no problems would highly recommend!

r9GW5XAZiW2ygmVQvDH6xg.text: So ok my coworkers told me about this place  and after waiting 20 min for a rainbow roll these fools have the nerve to charge 50 cents for ponzu sauce because it was Togo but if I ate there it's free. Smh rip off

FjMPfD9dLXv52Ntq9Owxyw.text: Dropped in last minute to join some friends and decided on the AYCE because we wanted to "share" what we were individually ordering. Nothing was really spectacular, aside from the baked mussels & the salmon skin hand roll. Service was good, and quick. However, my friend ordered fried bananas at last call only to find out ten minutes later the oil had been turned off and they weren't able to fry it. The manager was nice enough to come over and aplogize about it, which we appreciated. All in all a pleasant experience, but not enough to win over my go to spots.

mlY7_gYi5yCOgaV8KInirg.text: This place is the closest sushi restaurant to me so my boyfriend and I wanted to try it. We had people telling us they liked this place so we went a few nights ago and first we waited about 20 minutes to get seated when the table was ready the whole time then another 10 minutes to wait for someone to ask our drink order until and didn't come back for another 10 minutes.. at this point we were both hungry and couldn't wait for who knows how long for someone to ask if we wanted food.. we ended up leaving and they didn't seem to care that a customer was walking out. Some of the worst service I have ever received in a long time.

d3J3uvWnYz6N_lhEk5g9Ug.text: Went in there sunday morning mothers day at 11a.....That place filled up in no time.  excellent food and service....I honestly dont know how they pulled it off with only the 2 chefs and some extras....take out orders all over the place...the chefs were justin and nelson, great guys, and again, excellent service....ps  order the mussels!!!

EVnz0Fsy-Tfc8lFe-haUIA.text: First off, I really loved the sushi here. The variety was pretty good. I also really liked how attentive the staff were, always asking how our party was doing and such. My second point would be how well set up the place was, I love the little fish tank by the bar.   However, I know I will not be returning, only for the 1 reason that made the experience horrible. There is 1 apparent regular that pushed the limits of being loud and obnoxious. He sat at the bar verbally bashing just about everyone and everything in the place during his drunken stupor. The staff seemed to enjoy him being there and appeared to like him so I quietly finished and left, but clearly the workers here like being called slackers and librarians, so it's all good.   I would definitely recommend the food, but won't return to the environment myself.

Cih0xeOHGn75isQNIyGstw.text: I actually love the differences that there sushi rolls taste. I just have one issue when I ask for a roll with soft shelled crab, I am expecting soft shelled crab and not imitation crab meat. I was told it was they way the person mixes the soft shelled crab. This is the first time here I have had to experience soft shelled crab in the texture of imitation crab meat. This is the second place that has had me question wether the soft shelled crab was actually that. I tore the sushi roll (burning night- mixed green onion, masago, onion, spicy tuna, albacore, jalapeno on top, garlic sauce)  apart and it taste and texture was imitation crab meat. Now they all taste great just wanted the texture that I was looking for in the soft shelled crab. Also the price during happy hour is very reasonable.  *Shark's Tale - Lobster, Salmon, Snow crab tempura, avocado with eel sauce *Las Vegas Roll (no rice) - Yellowtail tempura, Kaiware, Crab meat, Masago/cucumber layer, Spicy yum sauce *Burning night- Mixed green onion, Masago, Onion, Spicy tuna, Albacore, Jalapeno on top, Garlic sauce

0EygK2z927QfwCxcQpOWjg.text: Really great sushi with many no rice options and cucumber rolls as well as great rice rolls. Service is great and done as a group approach.  Surprisingly really loved the cabbage salad !

wMrdGN7tgdSkeSLtn9ASQg.text: I was dying to try something local and was happy to find this place!  Its your basic casual, no frills type of place.   - Chicken Yakitori. It's OK. ~$4 for 2 pieces (which is standard) - but I could go without it next time. + Rolls are 50% off during happy hour - score! Most of them are cooked.. I tried the Snow White and Sharks Tale. The Sharks Tale has a bit of wasabi mixed in with the Salmon and Snow Crab but it's bearable. I never have wasabi and was able to eat this with no problems.. The Snow White is one of the rolls that isn't cooked. As much as I prefer something raw vs. cooked - I'd have to say the Sharks Tale was the best of these two rolls.  + Hot green tea. Roughly $2 (I think it's like $1.75 or something). It comes in a tea pot which is great so you don't have to keep asking for refills. It comes in a tea bag.   If you're staying at the Doubletree this is a good nearby option. I could be within walking distance - just depends if you want to walk 1.5 miles one way or not. I'd rather Lyft =)

KQRX5x3RI9te62wAvO2kHg.text: Went here Sunday @ around 4 pm with a total company of 4. Did the AYCE and started with   salmon poke -- it is mixed with seaweed salad. this i would rate 2/5, taste was ok but too much seaweed salad mixed with it.   uni -- it was good, 3/5.  amaebi (sweet shrimp) - 3/5.  lobster roll - 3/5, i did not taste lobster in it and the wasabi mixed in it overpowered it.  also ordered a couple of regular rolls like the scallop and salmon yum yum, 3/5-- all were room temperature which was a little weird.  what disappointed me was when i ordered 'rock and roll,'  i thought it was mostly sashimi of fish but it was fish inside shave cucumber -- mostly cucumber that'll fill you up moreso than the fish --  i did not expect it to be like that and ate all my fish, the waiter came to me and said "WE WILL CHARGE YOU EXTRA IF YOU DO NOT EAT the cucumber" so I made sure I finished all the cucumber.  i've been to a lot of sushi place and this was the first time this ever happened to me - i would have taken it better if it was said in a polite manner but no, it wasn't.   Steven, sushi chef- was amazing and tried making up for it (i told him ok, give me sushi that doesn't have a lof of rice in it) and he did-- but because i ate all the cucumber (rock n roll) i was so full of it, i couldn't enjoy any sushi anymore.  there was no manager that day so i finished off and left. I called the next day to let the manager know about what happened and she apologized, Apology accepted but I will never go back to this place -- there are TOO many sushi places in LAS VEGAS and for the quality and price -- I can easily go somewhere else and get an excellent service with the same caliber if not better, sushi.   in the end, i left super full of cucumber and very much disappointed. i would most definitely can give it a second try but my experience had me left with a bad taste in my mouth in more occasion than one.

photos.caption: Photo of Daisho Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Rock n roll-had to finish all the cucumber, so little fish. Left me soo full of cucumber, I could not enjoy anymore sushi after.

3SY4kPR7mjH4_-ryxJRL8A.text: Local sushi joint (like walking distance from my house) with an actually legitimate selection of nigiri. I'm not usually one for rolls, so I didn't check those out, but the list looked decent on the menu.  Bonus: $25 ayce for dinner includes rolls, nigiri, soups, salads, etc.  extra bonus: the grand opening is still going so it's half off all rolls

MgR91uSMAB7b7csLcZwVmw.text: Hands down the best AYCE sushi place in Vegas. My husband and I have tried multiple other sushi places but this is still our favorite to this day. Food is always fresh, service is great and they remember their returning customers!

9QAvfQC8s0bKn0rqhnYIGA.text: The sushi here is honestly mediocre. I've eaten all over and this was just average/below average. The half price for two regular rolls was cool but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone honestly. Take your dollars somewhere else if you want good sushi.

yqGc4cTU58iTKwpP5mLozA.text: Been to this place a few times now,  the food's always great!  Love the Triple Bang!  Highly recommended! This last time I went,  I noticed they had updated some technology inside.  The video wall is awesome! Definitely makes this place unique! And the big fish at the entrance looks so alive.  Definitely recommend this place for date night to express the girl or just hanging out with friend! Best sushi environment I've been to.

BeY2LJkoh2uiXq_IWTTOUQ.text: I'm not sure who else has review this place to give it so many stars. The service is decent but not great.  The sushi is basic and doesn't taste very good at all. This is way over priced for the quality of food served. Even the fried ice cream tasted microwaved. I wish I could review this and provide a lesser amount of stars.

QEpeSiZXNLnBQFkFy0KZiA.text: You know that unassuming place in your neighborhood that you constantly pass by and mentally bookmark to try sometime, someday? Well, that's what Daisho Sushi was for me. Located in the same plaza as Walmart Neighborhood, this little restaurant is great for a quick bite without the hassle of crowds.   It was practically empty both times we stopped in during their lunch specials from 11-4p, so happy hour and dinner might be a completely different story. Daisho has 50% off rolls and drink specials during happy hour and an AYCE option, but I can only speak of their lunch.  For around $8, my teriyaki chicken combo included: miso soup, salad, steamed rice, 4 pieces of california roll, and shrimp+veggie tempura. Suffice it to say, you'll leave full with leftovers. Collectively, I was also able to try their baked mussels (first timer), tofu (nothing special), siomai (kind of small) as appetizers along with a sweet cold sake (strong for me), which is served in an ice bucket.   Their digital artwork on the walls is pretty novel. A projector renders their centerpiece mural with movement and by the host stand, a marlin mount appears to be amongst waves... Overall, the service we received was fast and friendly. We'll be back to drop in again.

Gt4TU3L586A2viqdM_h44Q.text: Simply the best! All you can eat for lunch is only 25 dollars and dinner is like 32 dollars  The menu is HUGE! I repeat HUGE! All kinds of salads and chicken and different items on the menu. The sushi is great! Always fresh and made perfectly! You can even ask for them to do a roll a certain way and they do it! The seafood salad is incredible. May arrays of fish in the salad along with the most colorful produce ! They have great Oysters ( no limit)  and they have soft shell blue crab on dinner only limit 1 ( I believe)  I go there every time I am in town and have time!!! You will not be disappointed if you like fresh HIGH QUALITY food!

8EYy95VmLExrlfAmFIsFcQ.text: I probably didn't give this business a fair shake the first time around. I'll attribute it to being a rookie Yelper that wrote a snap review because my gullet couldn't be fed at a fast enough pace. Since I thought the sushi was good the first time, I should have stopped back again before I wrote my review to see if they would show their True colors, and they have. I have returned 6 times over the last year and the service has been significantly better.  There seems to be stability in the employee turnover as we have had the same servers on the last three visits. Everyone is more attentive and the waits to order more food are pretty much non existent. The kitchen seems to always be on the slow side, but the sushi chefs have consistently been more efficient compared to my initial visit.  In the last year, the actual menus have been replaced, but the content is pretty much the same. Keep an eye on the specials board because they'll occasionally throw something different into the mix, like blue fin tuna or jellyfish. More recently, I've been sticking to just the apps and nigiri, so I can't comment on the roll situation.  Sometimes the uni has me raising an eyebrow, but I think their sushi is just fine for AYCE level, and good enough to make return trips for $26 a pop when I'm in the area. The menu also has plenty of non sushi items which will keep my wife and daughter happy. Good job Daisho, we'll see you next time.

Photo of Daisho Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States

EibXZL1LQW4SWdWDJy0jjQ.text: I've been to most AYCE sushi spots in the SE and SW parts of town.  Until I tried this place, I didn't believe you could get good sushi outside of Chinatown and SW valley.  Sure they have some shrimp tempura and cream cheese type rolls but that is so from all they offer there.  The food is top notch, eat at the bar during the week and the chef will treat you to some omakase style dining.  I liked Chef Danny.  My favorite is the One Night Stand, I get a half-order.  If this place offered more diverse no-rice rolls I would come in more often.

fKaspyWJV9B8_HJtqGShhg.text: TERRIBLE SERVICE. In the hour and a half that we were sitting at our table our server only approached us for waters and the first round of sushi. We are patient enough people that we waited a half hour after eating the first round before our one year old started fussing and I finally had to wave the manager down to order another set of rolls. We ordered 5 and only received 4 which also took another 30 minutes of us literally sitting waiting at an empty table while our son only got more and more fussy. While we waited a female server cleared the leftovers from our table and asked if we wanted our check. WHAT?! We've barely eaten anything and if it's that noticeable to your employees that we look finished, why didn't our original server come ask if we wanted anything else??   This whole experience totally sucks because the menu is decent, my husband and I love a good sushi spot and this could've been our go to. We both work in the service industry and tip really well. This is the second time we've been ignored while eating here. I was just hoping the first time was because they were busy. Different servers though so it's now obvious that management needs to re-train the servers to be more attentive to their assigned tables.

7ZPeZEFBkzANk5KcECGgvA.text: I was enjoying the AYCE sushi and I received my check and paid for my food, I was about to walk out the restaurant and the manger told me to stop and aggressively approached me forcing me to give a good tip. I left a $2 tip because I didn't want to cause any problems. Even though they should not force the customer to leave tip

lMmH5L6fJQCcRHIQaYYskw.text: Overall a great experience    I came here for an early dinner, the place was fairly empty. Looks like I made it before the dinner rush. Was greeted by the waitress right away and sat at the bar. I got the typical AYCE Vegas Sushi experience...which is a good thing...trust me the AYCE Sushi joints in this town have a winning formula down. Fast, efficient with a large diverse menu.  The staff here is fast, efficient and friendly. The menu is also large and diverse. I liked all the nigiri and rolls I ordered. The are a few dishes that I would skip the next time I come here. I didn't care for the batter on the Soft Shell Crab Tempura or the Fried Oysters. To me, they were off...not a a fan, too oily for me...light, but greasy, not light and crispy. I would also skip the Pork Belly and the Yellowtail Collar. I've eaten much better Pork Belly at Korean Restaurants or Shabu Shabu places, nothing stood about this one. The Yellowtail Collar is fine, its just a ton of white meat, felt like I was eating a fish steak, could be more tender and moist.   I can definitely seem myself returning.

photos.caption: Photo of Daisho Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Green Tea Mochi - 4/5
Photo of Daisho Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon, Tuna &amp; Blue Crab - 4/5
Photo of Daisho Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tea pot

lzWaVcJ0n9peJLXgpbQq3g.text: I love this place, always great service, the best all you can eat in town. I'm always introducing new people here.

eR-hq98RI_KOkaui91Ma-w.text: I didn't have the AYCE. The rolls tasted alright but portions were tiny and felt really overpriced.   The fried soft shell crab was actually really good.   But the fresh oysters...they tasted like the oysters in a bottle that you can get from Costco. I suspect they bought those in bulk, took them out from the bottles and laid them out on shells. It's disgusting.

BzCXBS81XAS4zLJ6rE3hLQ.text: Pretty good, but not the best. The service wasn't that great. I told the server it was our first time visiting the restaurant and would need a moment to look at the menu, she took that pretty literally and was back in a minute. The rolls were just okay as well. I ordered a tempura roll (not sure of the name, sorry) and it just tasted extremely garlicky for some reason. Not in a good way either. They use this garlic sauce on their edamame and it tasted like they poured that all over the roll, but the description said it was supposed to be eel sauce....so idk. I did order the Sun of the beech roll (not sure how its spelled at this restaurant)  and it was pretty good. The blue fin nigiri was also really good.  Just an okay place for me.

31M24lGJSaaZt2dMa6mf9Q.text: I absolutely love this restaurant! I have been to other big and expensive sushi restaurants in Las Vegas but this is my absolute favorite! There prices are very reasonable and even have daily specials!  A great atmosphere for everyone.

8YyXrwnIcGmy-PqbkBZpWQ.text: They have a great ayce and happy hour with 1/2 price rolls. I love their lunch specials and quick service but wish they had a better selection of non sushi items.

03491wpfokxxPyxqZdFJqw.text: Best 'All You Can Eat' sushi I've ever had. And they're up there with the best sushi I've ever had, period. At the least they're by far the best sushi you can get for the money.

XplGz4J5o2brsuWuqQY02g.text: Had my first experience here last night. Made a reservation over the phone for a party of 8. As soon as we walked in the door they knew exactly who we were and was seated right away. Our server came immediately after and drinks and appetizers came quickly. The food is amazing! Best yet! The server was very informative on the dishes and she made awesome suggestions. The owner was friendly and made sure our party was okay. Daisho has 5 star service and 5 star food. We will definitely be back soon.

AQ1JTtzhCl__sdTxVPt3BA.text: Terrible service... Never got my food after waiting 40 mins....  People arrived after me and got served with in minutes of sitting down...  Server tried to make an excuses....  Asked to speak to the manager and he never came over..  Don't waste your time here...

PNPBoRI14bvNJf0y-8X77w.text: Very good sushi. . I am picky, but this place holds up. Very cool NYC vibe too. Late night half off is too good to not take advantage of.   Great service, good place. I suggest it

Il0cryMcFZ0FVekiBqQqHQ.text: Went here the other night with a friend for dinner since she was craving for some sushi. I had no idea this was in the same plaza as the Ohana Haiwaiian place! Anyways, the sushi rolls were pretty good (esp. the Daisho and Starfish). The nigiri was a hit or miss for me. Some of their fish was obviously not fresh while the others were pretty good. I would recommend getting the yuzu salmon and garlic tuna. The seared salmon was not even seared at all and the scallops didn't have much taste to it. I would not recommend the chicken and beef skewers at all. They were pretty tough to chew and it was weird because they didn't look natural (I'll post pictures so you can see what I mean). It looked like they just blended the meat together and just reformed it into one piece. They ran out of the enoki bacon so I didn't get to try that one.   Anyways, this place is decent for an AYCE in the Henderson area. It's not the best, but not the worst. If you are in the area and are craving for some sushi, this place will get the job done, but if distance is not a factor, stick to places like Sushi Neko or Sushi Twister.

C61Xzu0-PaEqKMwlBs9Tvw.text: I tried once again to place an order with Daisho. I ordered a lunch special from their menu online for $8.95 but they tell me my total is $12.95!! I told her that their menu says $8.95 so $4.00 in tax makes no sense. She says "oh, those prices changed a long time ago". So they don't care that their menus are nearly a year outdated and their prices increased by 50%! With business sense like this, it is only a matter of time before their business is shut down!

I order 6 handroll and all of them were poorly rolled and had literally 2-3 small bites. and I was charged about $55. i dont mind paying the price for quality food but this food was just ridiculous, they should be ashamed about the products they give to customers.

pMbb_qih9lgdBHH5MzN3iw.text: Sushi - Mediocre Ordered a piece of fish and they gave us one with a THICK piece of sinew, tried but can't chew at all.  Rolls - Got their 2 most expensive rolls, they did not WOW us.  Service - Very good, guy came over and exchanged the sinew dish immediately  Over charging - Made mistake on the bill and over charge us, good thing we checked and they fixed it.  We wanted to like this place but 2 major mistake in a roll, it's tough to do.

mSlM0Nsmw4ZKYsT-DcqcUQ.text: Worst customer service ever! Staff was rude and non welcoming! Sushi is okay they just need nicer people working there!

q6YyWFlKUzJ2oqjtV1honQ.text: This place is pretty bomb. Never been here before it's hard to find a good solid sushi spot with a awesome happy hour and the presentation of the food is really nice. Definitely will be back! The gyozas the yellowtail and the chicken yakisoba for the win!

jLuAzZtOGDCf9q0d3odEEQ.text: Update on my previous pre grand opening review.  This time we tried the bluefin tuna, wow! I see why Japan pays so much for bluefin simply the best. Amaebi was the largest size I've ever had. No rice rolls were yummy & very well presented. Oysters were very fresh, & my favorite black cod was again to die for. Service was excellent. This has moved past Yama as my favorite sushi spot.

hCNsvtwbxSY5jFoC7Q0FWw.text: I have been to this restaurant a few times. I love the quality of the sushi, but the employees suck. I only gave this review four stars because of how good the food is. The workers aren't rude, they just don't provide great customer service.

CunhKoUEeW6wPAxvAxgKXw.text: My boyfriend and i came to daisno sushi for a date night. The waiter and waitress were very friendly and helpful. Food is super delicious, with sizable portions, and quick service. The staff is very friendly, even took the time to take a photo (multiple photos because I like lots of options) and knowledgable about the menu. Our date nights are always a success when we come here and it's always a lot of fun.

Ja5iQFUyP49tqHvsqPQrFg.text: All you can eat for $20 lunch and $25 dinner. You order off the menu, they make it and bring it out to you. The waiter was awesome, sushi was good and instead of paying $300 on the strip, we Ubered and spent $100. Next visit to Vegas, we'll be back!!

hgMPw9Opl8oTOzPUwyWSDg.text: One of my favorite places. I will sometimes just go by myself to eat, and have a glass of wine. The sushi chefs are so friendly. Definitely recommend.

22mEpmfJUELoKAZ7T_7mFg.text: We came here for lunch, our "first time experience". The room is nice the chairs were comfortable.  I had the special roll combo. The rolls that I selected were pretty tasty and the size of the rolls were perfect, not to large and not loaded with rice. The special came with "salad" and miso soup. The salad was not salad at all. It was a ramekin of shredded cabbage with a small drizzle of dressing. I found the miso soup to be weak.  My wife had the salmon tempura combo. The salmon and tempura were tasty but it came with a similar "salad" as my combo. We both ordered hot tea. This tea was so weak we wondered if the bag had been reused and we were surprised to find a $2 charge for it on the receipt.   The overall value was fair for what we received. There certainly was no home run hit here and we left smelling like deep fryer oil. If you have another sushi spot, stick with it.

S1ILY3TcEZwvYzwWlljnPA.text: Best sushi in town!Always fresh,service is great,the people are very attentive,became our favorite restaurant!

giKnxvieS58jmIj5NkU7kw.text: As a family we usually go for sushi night at least ones a month. Tonight we figured we would try something new & we came here. We were seated & all was good until our waitress came. She was very rude about explaining how their 50% off on special rolls. My daughter only wanted an order of California Roll & she insisted we get two roll since it was 50% off but we told her no, she only wants 1 order of it but she still continued to say "you should order two and just take it home is she doesn't finish" and again we said "no". We go on with our order and she brings back a teriyaki crab roll & California roll. I told her we didn't order the teriyaki & she took it back with an attitude. They didn't much of a good option for dessert either. Restroom door was very hard to open especially for a child. We definitely will not be going back.

_EmUWoEyhc9oGn8YB6K8pw.text: too much rice for every nigiri.  fatty albacore is so smelly because already changed color.   but service was good.  never wanna be back.

B5Ot0hcBQywE6MKRHkESlQ.text: The location is great! The story behind the chef is inspiring and I'm glad to support a local business owner.  We had dinner tonight and the service was incredible and the staff were very friendly.  The food was good. The Daisho Fried Rice was a big hit at our table and I highly recommend it. The portion size was enough for the three of us go share, along with other entrees. I will be going NA k to try some sushi rolls next time around.

-p1Umws3R4f1lNQtouUAiQ.text: Have eaten here both for AYCE lynch as well as AYCE dinner. Food was good. Some different unique items on their menu compared to the typical items. Quail egg wrapped with bacon tastes just like breakfast. Yum. Bacon wrapped Mushroom & bacon wrapped asparagus very good. Loved all the riceless rolls unfortunately they are only available fir dinner time.

The owner gives out cards for all u can eat after u buy 10 u get one free  then he tells u that u can't combine two cards to get the free all u can eat deal saying that it says on the card can't combine with any other! Offer ! It's the same offer lol its a free sushi just because u have two cards u can't get the free one that's so stupid and contradicting.   I mean after paying for 10 all u can eat to get one free what difference does it make ,Plus the quilty of the fish is getting bad the tuna with garlic had that white kinda nerves in it turned my stomach real sad when people just care on or about the money instead on how they treat there customers and the quilty of the food that's how a business goes under I won't be going back bye bye!   I'll be going back to sushi mon there the best by far!

bHZZ-AK2moRJLtwvUhp3aw.text: Delicious. We are really picky with sushi and have tried a few not so great ones since we moved to Vegas (we are newer to Vegas from the Bay Area) and were pleasantly surprised about how good their sushi was. All the fish tasted so fresh which is so important! And the restaurant itself is cute. Servers and chefs were friendly. Definitely our new go to sushi place. Not to mention their price point is great.

x9MvdvLH2UQNnP6iugsAsA.text: I've been to a lot of sushi places spots and this one is awesome! Very high quality, good prices and nice, clean atmosphere. Friendly attentive staff. 1/2 rolls still but I caught the all you can eat lunch for only $19.99. Great selection of nigiri and the rolls are amazing not stuffed full or rice. Highly recommend

ZnJTC83Y0log80J3LUQgPw.text: They really skim you on fish and rolls are either filled with just crab mix or some nickel  sized tiny prices of fish. Very disappointed. I posted a photo of rainbow roll with just a little piece of fish on top and a scallop roll with almost nothing but rice. Went here for lunch $20. All the good items on the menu that actually have fish in them and are not full of fillers are only available on the dinner AYCE menu $25. However, after seeing what they put in regular rolls I doubt there is much in them either. They have a 50% off regular rolls promo but there is nothing in them except rice and a flavor of some fish. Too many other good sushi places around here to ever come back here....

1stnRcjcgSYq6qkGTAgCPg.text: Have visited two times and really enjoy everything!  The location is great and not busy.  The food always tastes great The prices are decent right now with their grand opening  The staff has always been great but I think they should talk to their guests more. In comparison to other sushi places, if they worked on this they'd get a 5 star!

WZkDb-81mWk5IlytLlqloA.text: Love the fact that these guys are only a block away from our house!   Food is good too!   I love the bacon wrapped enoki appetizer  And of course our typical favorites we always get at any sushi place... Amaebi with the fried shrimp heads - MMM! Yummy!  Uni - my husbands fave Super White - so yummy and buttery tasting Salmon - like what you're always use to so good Surf Clam - always a must have  Rolls - We rarely have any rolls but when we do have them we are not disappointed   We'll be going back!

xIrbT7Ya15ZecjbOUIM-Kg.text: i have to say Worth a try~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ nice restaurant ! During our trip to vegas we were looking for a good sushi restaurant which didn't cost a small fortune, and that's exactly what this restaurant is. The space is tiny, so we were lucky to wait just a few minutes. We ordered the sushi and sashimi combination, which were great, but don't miss the yellow tail. It's something to be remembered !I have eaten at a number of sushi joints in my time and I must say that the sushi is not the best but is good quality for this price even better! I am not crazy about the size or decor of the place. I was skeptical at first, but my friend and I both went into it like virgins. We were amazed at the quality of the sushi.
