bsiLbLB2-S2zED0QbUreuw.text: I have eaten at Daisho a few times for it's happy hour. It's average at best, but during happy hour the rolls are extremely cheap! My apartment complex is right next door and that's the other reason my girlfriend and I eat here.  For AYCE you can find better. Take advantage of the happy hour if anything

1H7-NiOdenJdTKY81ySRrA.text: My boyfriend and I live very close to Daisho so it has become a late night staple for us. Their happy hour is such a good deal, especially because they do late night also. Their chefs special rolls are 50% off so we can easily justify ordering 5-6 of them. The staff has always been friendly and attentive. Plus they have Hana flavored sake!!! Daisho is a great local sushi joint with good deals and an inviting atmosphere - I definitely recommend it.

d1lQPsWMuxVpm2mPZRKC2g.text: Looking for a hole in the wall place to get some good sushi, this is the place. I highly recommend the Johny roll. All you can eat is 26$ and a great deal if you're super hungry but if not the regular menu is pretty cheap. Only thing is the sushi pieces are very small

6a50TIOAKdGZZojpNH9MaA.text: Decent sushi and what you would expect from a place like this. All u can eat for 25$, pretty good deal. Didnt get 5 stars just because  it didnt seem like the freshest ive ever had and the service was prompt but not super friendly. Overall good experience and would come here again because it is close to my house.

Z38fB9_-CcUc6FeHw-dkTw.text: Seriously the BEST sushi place ever! My brother recommended this place to us while visiting and I'd definitely go back to Vegas just for Daisho Sushi. Quality of the fish is on point. So fresh. The price... For AYCE, it's definitely worth it! The owner is such a cool person and service is great. I literally wanted to try every roll lol. You can order half rolls but it was all too good to order just half. Absolutely love everything!

jkKG-o5Fsv5KM7N9nabw6Q.text: Good food... but even better prices! That was the main reason why I decided to check this place. We went after 9:00pm to get the happy hour specials and it was def. worth it!

zPz5rKAmsK1TuFKY9WxWJw.text: Just "okay," which is unfortunate since I really wanted to like this place after reading all the good reviews.  Nothing really "wowed" me on the menu. There is a good selection of rolls and non-sushi items, but the selection of nigiri is the same as other AYCE sushi restaurants. The quality was ok, nothing special, nothing terrible. Service was lack-luster even though we were sitting at the bar and the restaurant was less than half-full.  I guess it is a good addition to the east side, but it wouldn't be my first choice if I was driving this far for AYCE sushi.

p_LFLE6hiKcdhQoNQFLhHg.text: Half off sushi happy hour, and if you buy $30 worth, you get a free cocktail! Good deal right? The girl we had as our server was a gem, so sweet! But a guy that came by made me feel ashamed for taking advantage of the deal. I ordered enough for leftovers the next day (and yes, I know sushi is only good for a short amount of time), but he said he thought I ordered too much and encouraged my friends to eat some of my food. I'm the type of person that feels bad saying anything negative about anyone (I even feel bad about rating them down 1 star) but my friends even thought he was a little out of line. The sushi was delicious though! I'll enjoy my leftovers tomorrow.

VlcSoQUXMxOHG0vGPLKdhQ.text: Wow!  All you can eat sushi for $24.95, and it includes uni, sweet shrimp, toro, blue crab, miso cod, etc.?    In Vegas for the night, I Yelp'd to find a sushi place nearby and this came up.  Their prices are quite reasonable but when you do the "All You Can Eat" special, you really can't go wrong!  I had all of the above along with octopus, halibut, salmon, yellowtail, seaweed salad, and a few other dishes and along with a beer and large sake, my bill came to $33.  Again, wow!  The quality was excellent!  Michael is the greeter/manager/owner(?), and he was wonderful with his recommendations.  I'm coming back here when I'm in Vegas, and bringing the wife, whom I miss terribly.

x6GZTC6GCGDbGbZjIl4HrA.text: We came here to celebrate my nephew's birthday.  The all you can eat is worth it for those who will eat the pricier dishes. I  had the black cod bento and it was delicious. If you bring a big party (more than 6 people), you will be charged 18% tip automatically.

qVc5RVzA-eI8SI75zCSNXQ.text: Like the environment and the staff was very friendly. All you can eat sushi is delicious with a lot of variety. Bathrooms are clean and neat looking.

0e1aYhhQyJSEGw7sQYOtGA.text: Came here for an impromptu dinner with my best friend & mother. It was Happy Hour, so the two "Chef's Special" rolls I ordered (the Paradise roll & the Casino Royal) were 50% off, which was cool. I also ordered garlic edamame & veggie tempura - both divine. Though the food was pretty good, the service was spotty. It took nearly 15 minutes to actually be served in an otherwise dead restaurant.

W8pr11Dv0yuJVdkPVfMNBQ.text: I usually try to give a place more than one try but I don't think I will be back.  The few rolls we ordered were good- Wildfire, Las Vegas, Stuffed tomato. Everything else was just meh...the miso black cod was tiny, the bacon wrapped enoki was limp and the japanese lasagna was the worst I've ever seen, they wrapped it in foil and it literally fell apart when we tried to eat it.  The worst for me was the amaebi that I had to send back cause they were fishy smelling and looked all gray instead of pink and clear.  The fresh oysters were not so fresh either, their only saving grace was the uni, at least that was fresh.  Yeah- Daisho, I tried you and you failed me...on to the next one...

8FZ_60d9E2MrYKYIudAcbQ.text: Okay I want to like this place and only giving two stars is really hard! The sushi was fresh and nice portions and the wildfire and sweet tomato are my new fave rolls.... But.... The service was below average. Felt uncomfortable there. And it didn't help that the guy, who based on other yelpers picks might be the owner was rude! I ordered a Snow White to him, he took my order then walked away. 10 min later I realized he wasn't coming back and didn't tell other chef about my order so I had to order it again. Our rolls were good but based on other yelpers picks who know him, we got short sticked on our presentation... I like the radish noodles with my sushi!  Then they don't do half rolls and with all you can eat there are so many limitations. I agree with other yelpers that with all those limitations I can go somewhere else! Only certain appetizers are included in all you can eat, you can only do one each of the rolls with no rice, and because of those rolls I had to pay dinner price at lunch time.  I really want to like this place as they had good selection and all. But I didn't feel comfy... When chef gave me attitude when I said most places have a tiger roll and it's good I was like what??? And they weren't very nice to my kid who loves sushi and loves sitting at the bar cause most places make it fun for her! So due to all that I gave two for quality of fish and selection but when I go out I want to enjoy myself!

Photo of Daisho Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sweet tomato!!

SbMqhP_L8oJj-7E9P2bytw.text: I basically live here. The food is amazing. The phoenix roll and what's wrong roll are to die for. Reasonably priced and such a friendly loving staff. And you must try the ice cream. The best in town. And I mean real ice cream with the chunk of ice you Knossos what I am talking about.

YKM3cnE5DwWNsY8h1Ayfiw.text: the manger is a very nice guy! All the sushi is so fresh! The best sushi in local place

0ojHq4ANDD_yGWjj73NlGQ.text: Myself and the fiance have been looking for some decent sushi in Henderson but have not found anything that really caught our eye.  We happened to notice Daisho just driving down the street and decided to give it a try at around 10pm.  There were a few customers at the bar, but otherwise the place was empty...and that surprised me.  We were glad to hear that there was a late night happy hour on both food and drinks.   We ordered a few different rolls (California crunch, spicy tuna),bacon yaki-tori, soup, edemame, saki, and some beers.  Everything tasted perfect.  Everything came out promptly and the waitress answered all of our questions politely.  The price was phenomenal, especially for the sheer amount of food that we ordered and the quality.  This will definitely be somewhere we frequent as we live just down the street and are always looking for some decent sushi later on without going on a long drive.

fbSsCDrYtxPNG9dKU7ZtdQ.text: Daisho is a great place. Very good sushi, I always get the All You Can Eat deal.

TOEmPi6B1vDQpPnIL-XOYA.text: Great atmosphere,  nice crew, great sushi when I asked for no spicy they got it right I'm. Super happy. If I'm over here I'd definitely go again. I'm very picky so I was pleased. All fresh and FAST.  Nothing over cooked. Pleasant all the way around.

Clq9LiuMDAcZMijF4egwBg.text: Ok I just love this sushi restaurant.  It's the neighborhoods best kept secret.  I've been coming here since it opened a couple of years ago and I always come back and bring friends and family.  Their sushi is always fresh and the prices rock.  There is always something on special.  The happy hour menu a little of everything awesome!  They have a all you can eat for $24.95 lunch and $26.95 for dinner desert included.  I've had the all you can eat here before and they keep the food flowing as fast as you can order it but remember like most places who offer all you can eat sushi they charge if you have a lot left over.  So order as much as you can eat but don't waist.     I like a place that pays attention to customer service.  I don't think I've ever been in there when the one of the owners wasn't there. They keep a close eye on the business and it shows because the service is always good and the food is always consistent.  I can't say enough good about this local gem.  If you haven't checked them out you're missing out.

yWQs_0Bj45xMcnGw8mjV6A.text: Ok so I had lunch here for the first time and we did the "all you can eat menu." Literally. I have to say that their menu features more options for all you can eat than most sushi spots in town. Normally your choices are pretty limited to plain or unpopular rolls. Fortunate for us, they allow you to order a lot of specialty rolls and give you the option of half or full servings. Lunch hour was pretty busy so I assumed it was good. I'm glad we went because it was great. Definitely hit it up for lunch if you have a chance. Great ambiance, service and friendly staff.

We got a lot of the regular rolls because they were 50% off. I would've gotten AYCE but there was too many of us and not everyone wanted it. I ordered the spicy crab, spicy spider, garlic albacore, Alaskan, and eel rolls, and shrimp and crab tempura appetizers with my boyfriend. The rolls were VERY tiny. It wasn't spicy and it had lettuce in it which was odd and something I've never heard of before. It messed with the flavor.

OuhwkjTsAIVWLjbO4x6CQg.text: More like a 3.5 review. Wanted to try a new sushi restaurant since the one we usually go to is closed Mondays. Soooooo....looked at a couple of places on Yelp and Daisho Sushi was what we decided on on a Monday night.  We came here around 7pm and it wasn't busy at all. There was a total of 6 people at the restaurant...including my bf and I. We never do AYCE sushi....we like ordering a la carte. So spicy tuna roll is what we wanted to start off with. It was pretty good....you can't really fk up that roll. Next we ordered a Godzilla and Spicy Girl.  Godzilla was supposed to have soft shell crab but we barely got any in there. There were actually more crab meat and avocados than anything else! Spicy Girl was good....a lot of flavors going on with that one. Presentation was nice and they don't skim you on rolls....it was packed with yummy goodness. Specialty rolls ranged from like $10.95-14.95.  Restaurant is on the smaller side so I can imagine you might have to wait for a table during busy/primetime hours. Overall, it was simply A-OK. We MIGHT be back but there are plenty of other sushi places we go to before we decide come back here.

obmRf84tbCnUJZet_8LLVQ.text: To date I've yet to meet a place that was as disappointing as Daisho sushi. I had went for lunch with two of my friends/co workers. A previous story about the owner had me suspicious enough. However two of us had never been and person number three was willing to give it another chance. Immediately it was evident that communication was lacking in this place. From the kitchen to the waitress. We started off with three waters to drink with lemon. The waters arrived timely, without lemon which I had asked for again. After that it took 20 minutes to receive them. Lemons that take twenty minutes? Ok...  Things didn't improve from there. I had ordered yakisoba noodles which again came out in a timely manner. The two sushi rolls I ordered however, as well as the sushi the other two ordered all took another 10-15 minutes to arrive. The place was not hugely busy, the food took way too long.  That being said, the actual meal was the most disappointing part. If I hadn't eaten the chicken yakisoba I'd be caps yelling a review. The yakisoba was ok, not something I'd order again but it wasn't bad. The sushi on the other hand was downright criminal. No flavor, yum scallops tasted like nothing and my spider roll had the feint hint of tempura flavor before fizzling out.  My friends didn't get any better than I did. Their rolls lifeless, badly rolled. I almost didn't take my left overs with me. Though I'm not one to waste food. Best part was one of the rolls which we never received and paid for since we needed to get going. Communication of course was horrible. Between staff owner and cook. We had even mentioned that if the roll wasn't started yet then it's okay, we will just cancel the order. The waitress assured us it was coming for 15 minutes, we left without it.  Simple point is this, don't come here. Blue fin is in the area. Down eastern and Maryland is yummy grill. Sushimon or Osaka is nearby. Go to one of those places and enjoy the food. This place is sadly run by someone with no passion for what good food is about. A most disappointing of findings.

They take your order, and then bring out the dishes.  We've never had a long wait, service and like water refills have been on point.    The food is fantastic! The all you can eat is around $25, plus you get a punch card after 10 ayce, you get one free, I think we are on our 3rd card :)  Everything we've gotten here has been fresh, and very tasty. G8m57w5KPlXK4wGc2DG6_w.text: I only tried a California roll once, at another sushi restaurant years ago, and today I had a sudden urge to try it again. I ordered take-out and everything was fast and easy.   I didn't know until I got home, how much I actually ordered! I had 8 Cali Rolls and 8 Garlic Albacore rolls. I wasn't unhappy at all, because the price was amazing for all of that!! Only 8 bucks!? Everything tasted fresh and the flavors mixed so well together. I cannot wait to try more!

MwDPYyxOlf6fcGDffOIjjw.text: Daisho was exactly what I was looking for on Friday afternoon when I stopped in for lunch. I had such a craving for sushi but was on a lunch break and needed somewhere close by but that would fit the bill. Inviting environment, good amount of people, friendly service and a whole lot of options.   I was pretty indecisive so I asked for a recommendation and my server mentioned the "what's wrong" roll, the Daisho roll and another of which I can't remember. They all sounded great but something kept pulling me back to the Warm Springs roll so I ended up ordering that. Crab mix, shrimp tempura, spicy tuna (although I subbed for regular tuna) eel sauce, yum sauce and I'm probably missing a few ingredients, but it was exactly what I was craving. Fresh, light but rich in flavor, satisfying, and a great portion. The roll was cut perfectly and didn't fall apart like some would say about other rolls made with rice paper, it held together even through soy sauce! Lol that's not the usual, am I right? Soy sauce seems to be the make or break sometimes, but not with this roll.   I initially started with a ginger salad which was fresh and light, great price point. And I also opted to try the spicy tuna cracker appetizer which was delicious! I'm a sucker for this appetizer at any restaurant but Daisho gave it their own twist and it was better than most I've tried. The avocado on top is such a nice, refreshing touch. The appetizer came with 6 "crackers" making this a shareable plate, which surprised me for the cost. Definitely love how reasonable and fair their menu pricing is!   If you haven't given Daisho a try, go for it, you'll be glad you did! I will definitely be back, thank you Daisho!

BgMdFcEA6EhOEhcM-s0tiw.text: I don't know honestly maybe it was the time of day that we went, or the fact that we didn't sit at the sushi bar, but it wasn't that great. I'd give 5 stars just for the interior though! Our server was standing there doing nothing and we couldn't get her attention to order more food or get water. The sushi quality wasn't fantastic and there were pieces of shell in my sushi from the quail egg. The salmon was the most disappointing :( it was the weirdest texture and didn't even look right. For the price of AYCE a person it definitely wasn't worth it. We won't be back.   Shout out to the bus boys who were the only ones running around doing things. Thanks for getting our servers attention for us. You guys deserve a raise.

9OkqUX8KFCpv5j1P7QBr7g.text: Outstanding. I consider it the best sushi in Las Vegas for several reasons. Highest on the list is the freshness and quality. Also ranking very high is the price point, management, staff, service and authenticity. I literally drive by dozens of closer AYCE and other sushi restaurants to get to Daisho.  I have eaten there dozens of times over the years but have never written a review. When my family came in from out of town we went in for a visit. Not all in the party were sushi eaters. All left happy and satiated.  The all you can eat option is the best for me. They place a reasonable limit of two per person on the high end items for good reason. They are not even offered elsewhere. My favorite items are the sea urchin with a quail egg and the black cod. They now offer Happy Hour drinks for $5 including exotic tropical drinks such as Mai Tai's, Fog Busters etc - the full monte!   While they do offer sushi that is covered in toppings I always suspect are intended to hide the fact the fish is not the freshest - Daisho leads with fresh fish and follows through with it. They also offer a great many - no rice options for those on the Keto or other diets

VheYL-G5pZolRc5WqsKQiQ.text: Some coworkers told me about Daisho and I've always gotta taste for sushi so I figured I should go in today and give it a shot.  I was not disappointed!    Location: It is located in a little plaza with a car wash, Walmart, and Chevron.  Kind of hidden but as long as you turn in one of the openings you're good since its all connected.  Food: I ordered the chicken teriyaki bento box (you could choose btwn 3 other meats like beef, shrimp, or salmon maybe?).  The prices differentiated depending on which meat you select, but I felt like they were fairly reasonable in comparison with other restaurants.  The bento box lunch comes with miso soup (fyi there are tofu pieces in the broth, which I could def do without), salad, steamed rice, and shrimp/veggie tempura mix.  The teriyaki sauce used was more on the sweet side, but not to the point it was overbearing.  All the servings of each food item were a good portion and it satisfied my craving for sure.  Service: I was greeted and seated promptly when I walked in the door.  The waitress I had was very attentive before I ordered and was coming back every couple minutes or so ready to take it down.  I definitely appreciated that.  Going to other places and having to wait 10 minutes to order is THE WORST esp. when you only have an hour.  Once my food was delivered, she only came around once to refill my water, but I didn't mind it.  I paid my bill and was out in about 45 minutes.  Pricing: The CHICKEN TERIYAKI bento box was $8.95 +tax.  There is also a 30-cent fee when using a card, whether it is debit or credit you still get charged.  The waitress did not bother to mention this to me which I found odd, but whatever, no big deal.  I suggest visiting during lunch hours, 11 am to 4 pm, to get the best deal.  There is a Yelp check-in offer but only when your bill is $30 or more.  Also, AYCE sushi is available for $21.95 (lunch) or $26.95 (dinner) BUT someone warned me that they give you an hour limit.  In my personal opinion it isn't worth it.  Overall, my experience was good and I will be coming back I'm sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Daisho Sushi - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken teriyaki bento box (lunch special)

yMy_Ngq2qkwG5I2sRml3nw.text: I needed a sushi fix and this has been on my list since we moved to town a few months ago. The young man at the front desk was very friendly and explained to me the happy hour specials and discounts and then took my order:  1 Philidel roll  1 California crunch 1 tempura udon $20  I am looking for a new sushi spot but I need the quality/quantity ratio to be equal as well as the price. This place did well on the price factor. $20 is reasonable for what I received. The udon broth was tasty and they gave me a big portion with tons of noodles and not to much seaweed. The rolls themselves were small but that is something I am finding to be commonplace with Las Vegas sushi joints. They were fresh, even the next day when i took them for lunch. Not too much rice, but I will point out I did not care for the white sauce on the California crunch roll. Also I wish there was more cream cheese in the Philadelphia roll.   The downside is: the customer service I received from the woman who brought out my food was very cold and ungrateful. She did not repeat back to me the items i ordered. I could have received the complete wrong order. Also, she put everything in one small plastic sack. See photo...my udon noodle bowl was leaking and crushed the box containing my rolls. I am also 100% sure they knew it was leaking because the bowl was wrapped in napkins. A message to management; please set the expectation that you want your customer's food to make it home by bagging large items separately as to not leak or damage other food. It would take 1 minute and 1 extra bag.   Despite the quickness of service and he quality of sushi I do not know if I will give this place another try. Like the other yelper stated- the music playing inside is horrible. Hyper techno does not mix well wish sushi dining. If I was getting AYCE sushi at this place I wouldn't stay beyond 2 plates so I could escape the music. Maybe that's the point?

mC3oWa7F-ElEOFlmV2Rr_g.text: A friend and I went to Daisho Sushi for the first time today for lunch.  When we sat at the sushi bar my friend noticed that they had a B rating from the health department.  I didn't see it because it was way up high on a shelve near the ceiling.  When I asked the waitress about the rating she acted like she didn't know what I was talking about until I pointed at the B rating card.  She told me "it was an unannounced visit and they found fish that was defrosted too much and the air got to it."  I told the waitress and the sushi chef that we were leaving because of their B rating.    I looked up the rating system on the health district website and found to get a B rating they had 11 to 20 critical demerits and will get re-inspected within 15 days.

TyECgwH_BU_b6nK1t9_rtg.text: WORST SERVICE EVER! I came here with my husband for dinner. We go to sushi places all over town, and decided to try this place. The waitress approached our table & we ordered 3 sushi rolls and a bottle of wine, a moment later the manager walked up to our table & told us we should order the all you can eat sushi instead, he said we would be getting more for our money, so we took his advice and ordered two all you can eat for $24.95 each. Never were we told we had to eat every last bite of sushi on our plate or they would charge us and additional $10 leftover fee. We have eaten all you can eat sushi at least at a dozen other sushi diners and NEVER did they charge us a fee for not eating everything. The manager came up to our table yelling at us (while using profanity) when we said that we should not have to pay the $10 fee because there was no signs anywhere saying you had to eat everything on your plate or there would be a $10 charge (he said it was sushi law lol). I told him typically when I order all you can eat sushi they offer half rolls so you don't have much leftovers. Regardless, even when we had leftovers never did any place charge us for it. DO NOT EAT HERE. There are so many good sushi places in Las Vegas & Henderson, Daisho Sushi is very bland at best, but whats worse than the poor quality of sushi is the horrendous service this place has. I have never had a employee, much less a manager treat me so disrespectful, he didn't care there were other people trying to eat and children were present while he used profanity. This place I imagine will be closed down soon because of the tremendously poor service, plus they do anything they can to rip off their customers.

AJQ-e8t9H_S5D25ojuvW8w.text: This was my first time here. I had the Philadelphia roll and a California roll. The rice was very good and the sushi tasted very fresh. Service was wonderful. The only complaint would be that the rolls were very small. I don't know if this is standard or because they have a grand opening special with 50 percent off their rolls. That is only reason I deducted one star UPDATE: we went back for lunch again. This time we had a crunch shrimp roll and a California crunch roll. They were both seemed a lot bigger. Especially the California crunch roll. Very good and at such good prices!

qsNARO4PoF1zn79JN2MWfw.text: I love this place! It's down-to-Earth, not fancy, and the food is good... all of this combined means cheaply priced, delicious sushi! I originally came here because I have a Groupon... I still have that Groupon because the waitress was kind enough to point out that the Groupon doesn't expire until January and they had 1/2 priced regular rolls as a Grand Opening special. I am a fan of the "simpler" sushi rolls anyway, so this was like finding a gold mine, and I have been going back ever since. Their sushi is already so reasonably priced (without the 1/2 off) compared to the rest of Vegas that this means their Grand Opening special (which was still going as of 11/16/13) resulted in $2-3 regular rolls.   The rolls are pretty standard and the ingredients are fresh. Considering I'm on a fixed income and a sushi addict, I couldn't ask for more from a sushi place!

3u_pxQgjF9015FFQ0kqDtw.text: I love sushi and this place meet my expectations, I recommend trying it.  the employees are friendly.

Luckily i had finished with a cheap roll so it wasn't bad. Just keep in mind and start with the expensive rolls and work towards the cheaper rolls and nigiri. The salmon collar was also delicious!

_29Mdnkej14lXfOlCACFGA.text: My husband and I were delighted to find this gem had finally opened! We've been anxiously waiting for what seemed like forever!!!  We've both been in the service industry for more then a decade and we were totally impressed from everything like the servers who were sweet and accommodating to the owner who not only introduced himself but engaged us in conversation even got our background and remembered our names when we came back the second time.  The sushi was great, but the attitude of the owner and his enthusiasm to make his establishment a success.  I don't see this much excitement and passion from someone very often in my business. It's so refreshing to see someone with that much passion about his dream. This will be our go to spot on date night from now on.  I look forward to tasting the next valley of fire or warm springs roll. Two of our favorites!  I urge anyone who reads this to take a chance on a great new neighborhood sushi restaurant that seems to put guest service and a desire to be a success first! I love DAISHO!  Welcome to the neighborhood!   Tamara and Rick C

I had some sushi that I had not had since I left Chicago 20 years ago!!!  Awesome!!! PLIGOay8MsBkq7aesDLfZw.text: I just tried Daisho today and I was impressed. My boyfriend and I had the AYCE dinner for 24.95 each. The quality of fish was pretty good. The owner actually was making our rolls because we sat at the bar and he is a sushi chef at his own restaurant. I thought that was pretty cool. The wildfire? Roll was fantastic along with the tempura snow crab. The friend  banana for dessert is so tasty! The menu was great. I felt like the nigiri menu had more items on it then most other sushi places. There were a couple of orders that we had to make multiple times before we actually got it. That is the only negative thing, but it can happen anywhere. I'll definitely be returning to Daisho.

BPtA4En0vikW1DwW2ptRog.text: Great service and incredible menu. I lived the Rock n Roll roll. I highly suggest it. The all you can eat is great, but they don't do half rolls.

fspCii1yEWlt5whCnQd2xg.text: A friend recommended this place. My wife and I have been a total of 3 times over the last two months.  It's gotten increasingly worse every time.  We only do the AYCE. The first time was really good. Great selection, food was good,  sushi came out quickly, and the service was prompt.  The second time wasn't as good overall.  Food was still good,  but the service was lacking.  The third time was just atrocious!  The nigiri came out with the biggest balls of rice I've ever seen at any sushi restaurant, topped with the thinnest slice of fish.  It was so hard to eat. I literally had to drink water with the food in my mouth just to get the rice down.  We were waiting so long to get each of the things we ordered.  I brought up our concern to the waitress and asked if she remembered us from last week and she said yes. I told her that this wasn't the same experience we had then and the food was nothing like it was.  I got no response,  she just nodded her head and walked away to where what I assume is the manager and another coworker were standing.  It was obvious she was telling them what I had said.  The entire group thought it was funny. The manager didn't even bother to come talk to us!  The place only had one other table occupied, it's not like they were too busy. This last experience was a bummer because the place can be a really good find.  I recommend gambling on this place. That's exactly what it's been,  a gamble.

TXcJasEjGmAfwaVsaNNxSA.text: I just tried the sharks tale.....and its probably the best thing I have had here. Prices are very decent the service is awesome.  The people here will check on how your doing and don't wait until your done with your meal before coming back again. Overall, this place is very clean and I would recommend it for anyone.

My only complaint is Ive been there 3 times and ordered the fried calamari but they dont have it. Not sure whats up with that. I will definitely go back and keep bugging them about it.

aVzd67glAXfFcSXFF2kXzw.text: maybe the worst sushi i have ever had. the sushi at smiths is way better and the sushi at smiths sucks. we decided to go for the 50% off happy hour special, but the joke was on us because when they say 50% off they mean the size of the rolls. they rolls are pencil dick thin.' at first i was trying to figure out how they could make them so small...they are a bit bigger than a nickel but not quite as big around as a quarter...the sushi chef here must really pride himself on the ability to cheat the customer.  I can not for the life of me figure out how this place has a good rating on yelp. if you love sushi stay away from this place.

sHSlgv3_Hez3UpRDFwP5CQ.text: I love it here !  I saw daisho a couple weeks ago and was not very intrigued to go in . The neighboring buildings did not complement or compel me to eat sushi. Until one day (Friday) I was rather hungry and found myself driving to what ever caught my eye. And I saw that daisho had "regular rolls 50% off" and I do love my sushi and especially for 50% cheaper :)    At first viewing daisho from the exterior I did not find it very appealing . However when I walked it , I was presently surprised. It's interior is so pretty and the people were incredibly nice .   I am writing this review for the 2 times I visited daisho and both times they met my expectations and exceeded it.   The first time i got 4 regular rolls for $10 because it was BOGO free. They were okay but because I'm used to special rolls and haven't had a regular roll in ages .  The second time I went I went for the AYCE and OMG the choice in appetizers was ahhmaaazinng. ;) SERIOUSLY, your gonna give me salmon Kama? They also had skewers and I love bacon wrapped enoki mushroom however they did not cook it to my liking . And I was disappointed cause I was really looking forward to it. I'm scared of eating raw pork (because of my biology class). However everything else was really good ! I thought the food was about an 8 on a scale from 1-10 . But the thing that got me was definitely the service . I had jenny and Michael. Jenny was our server and she was so sweet and helpful. She was unfortunately the only server that night due to some mishaps she informed me about  but she still rushed to serve with a smile on her face .   So if you want good AYCE sushi, and excellent service that's cheaper than other places daisho is for you !

5XNjGLbd1uEn7uMkxP_1oA.text: One of the best sushi places I've ever had, especially for all you can eat. Daisho is probably the most underrated sushi place in Vegas. Thank you Lenard for the delicious food!

FXY2rtBBVRGkF9K_48-I4w.text: This place is a solid 2.5 so I have to be fair and round it up to a 3 star...  a.  Location - 5 star - On the southwest corner of Warm Springs and Eastern, very accessible from most parts of the valley. For us, it was a 10 minute easy drive from Henderson.  b.  Ambiance - 2 Star - A bit spartan in terms of feel and decor, however, that is cool. I would say the music was both loud and obnoxious.  Not sure how / why you would want your clients to dine in loud punkish modern music that is neither food for the soul or nurturing.  It was also loud enough that it nearly impeded conversation.  c.  Service - 2 Star - We got here at 6:00 and ordered two Bento type dishes and two AYCE sushi which comprised of about 5-6 choices.  Took about 50 minutes to get the first sushi after the two that had the Bento type boxes had theirs for about 15 minutes. I find that rather odd.  Also, when I asked for hot Green Tea, I was advised that they did not have green tea, but another kind.  I asked....is it Genmaicha and she came back with the little sweet tea bag that said genmaicha.  Well, I think I am a bit stuffy tea drinker because I like this type of tea in it's real form, a whopping two teaspoons of loose roasted rice and barley and tea leaves in a pot to steep and all the flavors of this very tasty tea.  Coming out of a tea bag..... nah.  d.  Food - 2 star - besides getting to us so late, here is the dealio:  - Bento Box with Teriyaki Beef - The beef was so dry and thin and overcooked and over sauced, it tasted like Costco Teriyaki Beef Jerky dipped in soy sauce. Wow. Both over powering and salty.  - Amaebi - This is a special dish I love because of the fresh raw shrimp and then the fried shrimp heads.  Where were the fried shrimp heads?  Come on, you cannot serve this dish half axx.  This is totally a boo hoo disappointing disaster.  - Maguro - I love to have Maguro Nigiri Sushi with a thin slice of lemon and thin slice of jalepeno. It really makes the taste perfect.  When you serve this with a SPAM size chunk of lemon and jalepeno, it actually over powers the Maguro and well, nigiri is all about complimentary and simple flavors, so this was a complete miss.  I had to remove all the lemon slices and jalepeno to make the maguro edible.  - Miso Cod, Hamachi Collar, Star Fish, Daisho Roll, Wild Fire, Mexican,   All the rolls were edible and uninspired. It did not help that they serve these sushi on huge American size platters instead of smaller plates that match. It was hard to fit plates onto our table, and it was very unappetizing.  e.  Overall - 2 star - really?  Food was barely adequate. Not prepared properly, Japanese is all about presentation and the food was poorly presented.  I was really shocked because after reading the review s I was raving to go celebrate my BD at this place and instead, I felt more like I compromised.   Worst part is that the place was empty for about 40 minutes and service was poor, then it was packed as so many groups came in, I had to go from shy asian boy to obnoxiously loud demanding diner boy and keep pushing for service, food and the bill...  I was shocked!  DAISHO in japanese means big victory or soaring large.  This place needs to change its name to something else....  GK says, OK, I was a year older and depressed.  Go check this place out.  I will come here again and give it a second chance. It was all me the first time........ Fried Shrimp Heads, here I come...

W1AgihdR7xPpLuC_slAorA.text: Unlike many of the other restaurants I visited in Vegas, Daisho did more than satisfy my expectations. It exceeded them significantly. For a small sushi joint in an unassuming parking lot, the promise of a $27 all you can eat special seemed too good to be True. Now, it's fairly obvious that you'll never be getting the highest grade food here. The bluefin wasn't as buttery as it could be, the rolls tasted almost doughlike, barely masked by the propensity for American sushi joints to smother everything in sauce (and thus seek to veil their food's inconsistencies and faults), and the scampi erred more towards the tough and briny rather than sweet and tender. But for that price, does it really matter? As I was putting away a dozen pieces of seared salmon nigiri, I wasn't overly concerned with the fact that the momentary sear barely helped to balance the fridge-chilled salmon meat. I'm not the biggest eater, but the sheer amount of food I was able to put away in about an hour (the dinner option for $27 offers 90 minutes) more than made up for the deficiencies in individual items. But as I was continually reminded, quantity has a quality all of its own, and I'm sure I'm not alone in wanting a decently priced, high quantity restaurant away from the overpriced, overgreased and overrated venues that seem to plague the bright lights of the Strip. On the upside, the super white tuna/mackerel was smooth, the scallops were tender and I didn't have any problems in getting the waiters' attention. They were very attentive in clearing plates and bringing tea/water for the steady stream of locals that came through, and I can clearly see why Daisho is such a valued neighbourhood spot. I'd take it over another average steak and cheese-choked fries any day of the week.

mrXJB_tveVt0Fx6eNK62eQ.text: Two weeks ago I was caught on Warm Springs and Eastern during a huge flood/hailstorm.  I pulled off into the Walmart shopping center to wait it out.  I spotted Daisho, and since the storm was showing no signs of letting up, I decided to go in.  I was so happy I did!!!  They had an all you can eat menu for 21.95.  The selection was great.  There was all kinds of appetizers, salads and desserts.  There was also a front and back page of sushi options that were included in the all you can eat price.  The only stipulation is that you must eat what you order, because they will charge you extra for wasted food.  I was alone that day, so I sat at the sushi bar.  I notified the sushi chef that I was pregnant and asked if he could let me know if anything I ordered had raw fish.  He went above and beyond and told me to order whatever I wanted and he would make sure he cooked anything that would have been raw.  Both of the sushi chefs working that day were very friendly and extremely attentive.  I ended up ordering 4 rolls in total. Had a cucumber salad and ordered a fried banana for dessert.  I highly recommend the Daisho roll.  I feel like I definitely got my money's worth.  I have been spreading the word about this great sushi place ever since, and I can't wait to go back!!

bJds51hlrgMcCt6rpCLFkQ.text: My boyfriend and I stopped by here because the AYCE ended at 4 21.95 not bad. But honestly the service was so bad! Service is fast, the food is great, lots of choices, and generous portions. The lunch boxes are awesome! This is my traditional after-nails treat.  The only suggestions I have are to turn down the AC - it's always frigid in here. Also, you never see them again after you're served, so you have to flag someone down for a drink refill. FhjsHOkYMHa5vUf7FwE_DQ.text: This isn't my usual sushi haunt but it's right up there tied for first place depending on what I'm in the mood for. The stuffed tomatoes (it's the name of a dish but doesn't actually involve tomatoes at all) are positively epic! The silky texture and fresh bright yet creamy flavor is borderline orgasmic. Service is good but the servers here tend to challenge orders which bothers me. I order something and get "are you sure you want that?" almost every time I've gone here. I'd love to try some of the salads on the all you can eat menu but I've been told the portions of the salads are big enough to be a meal on their own which is offputting because if I wanted just a salad and nothing else I wouldn't spend the money on all you can eat. The whole point of all you can eat, for me, is to try a variety of things. I've asked if I could just get a small portion because it's the same price either way with all you can eat but was told no. All you can eat sushi menus should be like Japanese dim sum, small portions big variety. This place has a huge variety but don't plan on trying much of it in a single sitting unless you're a competitive eater and be prepared to stand your ground when you ask for something like yum yum sauce on the squid instead of ponzu because they always seem to assume I'm a sushi virgin or something.

yIQb2rh7gwPL9tY5yN7L2w.text: Their happy hour is the BOMB. Cheap beer, cheap rolls. A frugal fantasy! I usually do AYCE because I'm a very hungry piggy. Because I've been let down soooo many times before at other restaraunts.  I particularly LOVE their shrimp bombs. Also, they have no-rice sushi rolls, many of which are fantastic- Great for Diabetics. Its also next to a neighborhood walmart- so if you need to get groceries after... you're in luck. Its a slightly small place- but it doesn't get too busy so thats just fine. Lunch is the best time, as its not crowded, and its nice an quiet-ish.

7Gz62K4i4qZwiRPTowZdVg.text: I used to go all the time even if the service was bad. At least the food was good. Today I had to walk out this place... dirty floor , dirty tables and waiter with attitude. Just not for me!

br5_ss35eyiFioEY1ATVbQ.text: We went here with a group of Yelpers. Honestly, I was having second thoughts about this place since the reviews seem inconsistent but with Tony T's guidance, we seem to have picked the right stuff from the menu. There were a few hiccups so I can't give this place shining 5 stars.  I tried the miso black cod, bacon-wrapped enoki, bacon-wrapped quail eggs, bacon-wrapped asparagus, yakitori beef, salmon poke, tuna poke, oysters, salmon skin handroll, uni, unagi, salmon, garlic tuna, amaebi, salmon collar, hamachi collar, Wild Fire, spicy tuna cracker, Starfish, fried bananas, red bean ice cream and yuzu ice cream.  5/5: I love bacon so obviously the clear winners for me were the bacon-wrapped quail eggs, asparagus and enoki mushrooms. Also, 5-star worthy items like oysters, salmon nigiri (super good!), Wild Fire (tuna, spicy tuna, soy paper, chopped albacore in garlic sauce. NO RICE) and Starfish (yellowtail tempura, daikon, scallion, tuna in ponzu and wasabi oil. NO RICE). Yuzu ice cream - I haven't been to an AYCE sushi restaurant that serves yuzu ice cream.  4/5: Salmon poke, tuna poke, garlic tuna, miso black cod (reminds me of Shiro's in Seattle), amaebi, salmon collar, spicy tuna cracker, fried bananas (get it with vanilla ice cream and well-rendered bacon topping) and salmon skin handroll (crispy skin).  3/5: Yakitori beef, uni (was a little bit watery), unagi. Hamachi collar was charred on the outside but undercooked on the inside. I was craving for some shrimp tempura. Melvin ordered it but it didn't look so promising and he said it was just ok so I didn't bother ordering it.  They give you real plates instead of the usual sushi plate and they'll give you a clean one if your plate gets really messy. The chef/owner kept checking on us and gave us beer on the house. After ordering 6-7 hamachi collars and 6-7 salmon collars, the restaurant smelled like smoke they had to keep the door open.  The service was great but I'm not sure if it's because we were with Tony or if it's because we're Yelpers or if it's because that's just the way they treat all their customers. I would have to come back again to figure that out...eventhough this is far from home, I wouldn't mind coming back here. $20 for lunch (11am-4pm) and $25 for dinner (4pm-close) and the food is pretty good. And no, they don't have pork belly.

ozZdAxggOPEb3JHMp8HXsg.text: Daisho Sushi is a moderate drive away from me (located in a large strip mall on the corner of S. Eastern and E. Warm Springs), but after making my way across town to try out their Dinner AYCE sushi, I am definitely a fan and considered the drive here well worth the effort for good food.  As the restaurant is still relatively new, they were not all that busy tonight (plus it was raining, and you know who people here shy away from driving under such precipitous conditions). So after being seated at the sushi bar, it was pretty much just me and Michael K here at the ~70 seats capacity sushi restaurant giving their menu a taste drive.  We started off with the usual limited to one per person orders:  Uni, Sweet Shrimp and Blue Crab nigiri, they were good.    We also gravitated towards their APPITIZERS section, and had ordered: * Salmon Collar (the salmon was so tasty and naturally fatty, it was amazing, like having "Kobe" salmon) and Yellowtail Collar (cooked just right and I really enjoyed it with and without the accompanied ponzu dipping sauce)  * Yaki-tori (skewers): Bacon wrapped Enoki Mushroom, Bacon wrapped Quail eggs, Bacon wrapped Asparagus.  At other restaurants you can order just skewers, paired with responsible consumption of beer and sake and call a great night out.  I really enjoyed these.  * Shrimp Bomb (it is like the Jalapeno popper with shrimp and crab, but without the jalapeno).  * Miso Black Cod - tasty!  Insane in the membrane that this is in the AYCE line up!!!  * Tuna Poki - the poki are prepared to order, not something that was made hours ago and left marinating in the cooler.  * Yellowtail Poki  SPECIAL ROLLS: * Star Fish (No Rice) made with Yellowtail Tempura, Daikon and wrapped in Tuna, finished with Wasabi Oil, Ponzu and Scallion.  (Recommended)  * Johny Roll (No Rice) made with Crab Meat, Shrimp Tempura wrapped in thin strip of cucumber and finished with Spicy Yum Sauce.  * Wild Fire Roll (No Rice) consist of Tuna, Spicy Tuna wrapped in Soy Paper, topped with Albacore and finished with Garlic Sauce.  * What's Wrong Roll (recommended by Chef Michael) made with Shrimp Tempura, Soft Shell Crab, Green Onions, Masago, Spicy Yum Sauce, topped with assorted fish and finished with Screaming Orgasm Sauce.  I could totally put away more food, but I have an appearance to make at Bacchanal the next day and thought I take it easy and just finished the meal with some Fried Banana with Ice Cream (it was a nice finish to the meal, but nothing that blows me away).  Totally satisfied and very impressed with the food we were served tonight.  There seems to be a handful of new sushi restaurants opening in Las Vegas recently, and most have had positive reviews thus far. So if the other freshmen sushi restaurants are as good as Daisho Sushi (which I now easily considered in my top 3 Las Vegas AYCE sushi restaurant list), the rest of the old guards will have good competition to keep everyone on their toes.  That is good news for all the diners out there.  Note:  Aside from AYCE sushi, Daisho also offers a la carte items for lunch and dinner in addition to their lunch and dinner specials.  And dinner starts from 4pm until closing.  Pricing are very competitive for AYCE (especially lunch, which does not seem to have a reduction in the selections available).  About the Chef: (kernels of knowledge gleamed from small talk during our meal) Chef Michael is from New York. His parents own a Japanese Ramen, Yaki-tori (Japanese skewers) and Sushi restaurant there.  So even before moving out to Las Vegas and working as one of the sushi chefs at Blue Ribbon Sushi (inside The Cosmopolitan), he was already familiar with the competitive restaurant business. So finally opening Daisho Sushi here in Las Vegas, just seems like the natural path of progression for this passionate young chef in a new city he now calls home.  (Haha, I sound like his autobiographer).  5 stars!  But as words spread and more and more people learn about Daisho Sushi, and the restaurant undoubtedly gets busier, I hope they can keep up with the projected increased interest in their restaurant and the food they serve.  Good luck Daisho Sushi!!!  And I will definitely be back and bringing friends to tryout the amazing food I had earlier tonight.

43iJMAmWOLmxJnYb5N_DAw.text: So I decided to make Daisho my last sushi spot before I cut back on AYCE sushi meals for awhile D': I've abused this whole all you can eat sushi privilege since I moved to Las Vegas a year ago and it's finally catch up on me. Le sigh.  Anyway, I decided to go with Daisho since it's the new buzzing spot on Yelp and I had to see what all the 5 stars were about.   - Decor -  To start off, the decor is mediocre. Nothing too special, but they have time to improve that later in the future and doesn't really affect my overall experience. The plates they provide are regular large circular ones you would normally find in any other restaurant that isn't serving sushi. Merh, I guess I'm just more used to the traditional small rectangular plates.   - Nigiri -  I can see why the majority of the ratings are 5 stars. The fish is the freshest I have tasted in awhile from the AYCE options. I feel like since sushi restaurants give you the option of eating as much as you can possibly can for a mere ~$25, they can serve not so high quality products. But I must say, the hotate (scallop) was delicious, and the uni was the best I have tasted in Vegas thus far. I've never had so much uni piled on one piece of nigiri. I was actually really shocked on the amount I was given. However, that was the only nigiri where I felt spoiled. Although the fish they serve were all fresh, the slices were really thin. HA! THAT'S WHERE THEY GET YOU! I knew it was too good to be True :( I guess you really can't have your cake and eat it too, oh what a world.   - Rolls -  Moving on to the rolls for those who don't care much for raw fish. Their rolls are surprisingly the biggest reason I'd come back again and again. AND I NEVER SAY THAT! So good news, they offer half order rolls, bad news is that you have to wait till your 2nd or 3rd round till they allow you that privilege. I love their 'no rice' rolls. Basically everything you would typically have in a roll except instead of being wrapped in seaweed it's wrapped in cucumber, and of course no rice. The one time I actually enjoy a roll, they put a restriction on it and say it's only one per person :( All the other rolls you are welcome to order as much as you like. They have a huge variety of rolls so if you're a roll lover, you've hit the jackpot. One thing I must make note of is that if your go-to roll is the spider roll... order the 'Godzilla Roll'. Their version of the Spider Roll incorporates lettuce (why??). The Godzilla roll is the usual Spider Roll you'd find at any other sushi restaurant.   -Appetizers, other items- Something I really enjoyed about Daisho that really sets it apart from other sushi places is their selection of appetizers. Quail egg wrapped bacon, asparagus wrapped bacon, and mushrooms wrapped bacon! I wasn't very fond of the "fresh" oysters since they were warm when they got to our table. There are many other items to make up for it though.  All around, not bad, not bad at all! I'll definitely be taking out-of-town friends here who are more into rolls than nigiri here.

MpIi2CEup5akpx30ZbXrqg.text: I frequent the adjacent market and live around the corner, so I stopped in for a lunch AYCE this week when I noticed the construction was finally over and the "Open" sign lit up -- and had a tremendous meal. I've visited 7 or 8 sushi places since I moved here 2 years ago -- at three of them MANY more than once -- and Daisho has already cracked my Top 2. Also, I have not seen a $19.95 price for AYCE Lunch anywhere else in Vegas - and now a sign in the window today promises 50% off rolls and AYCE for their Grand Opening (I did not get any further details as they were not yet open). Given that I work 11pm shifts, "Lunch" is my late-night feast :-)  Wherever it's offered, I always start out with an Ahi Poke... If for some odd reason I got to a sushi AYCE and suddenly wanted NO variety, I would just order four or five Ahi Pokes. This one had the perfect boldness and sesame backdrop. I had a few nigiri yellowtail, nigiri salmon, and a wrapped roll with avocado and shrimp. Then I realized that this was an un-planned stop and I shouldn't try to eat what I would when I prepare for an AYCE. So I called it a day.  I can't wait to go back. If you live in the area or are just visiting, you should have it at LEAST once.

3XRqg1P0EUScUsjepdllWQ.text: Well priced, high quality food with a great customer-oriented experience. You can't beat their happy hour. I met some sushi neighbors who introduced me to Sake. Woo! Seriously though, they ship in fresh quality seafood and it shows, you can taste it.

V3SjyeSdWvu3VASsEr9axg.text: I don't know if the special they have is all day but I've been here twice for lunch and basic cut and hand rolls are half off! Which means I got three rolls (most were about 6 pieces each) for less than $10. They were simpler, like spicy ahi and tiger.
